commit_message:
Replace "suspend" with "destroy" in failover cases

Snapshot with error after suspending node contains suspended node
which will be starter after dos.py revert-resume.
"Destroy" should be used in this cases.

Change-Id: If5146412bc33a74f7f7196bf496d2760c73925a7
Closes-bug:#1532748
(cherry picked from commit 214d6addce22242dad65d3ad9c901d29f51460a2)

commit_message:
Replaces __builtin__ with six.moves.builtins

__builtin__ does not exist in Python 3. Replacing it with
six.moves.builtins will ensure compatibility with both Python 2.7
and Python 3.4.

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

Change-Id: If99c9670644f95e2b5c37d14fad491d829850f36

commit_message:
Standardize bashate and add linters

The linters gate combindes pep8 and bashate (and then any other
linters we want). This changes bashate to be a sript rather than doing
a script inline. This matches the way other projects (and
project-config themselves) uses bashate [1].

Once a change upstream merges we can remove the redundant pep8 and
bashate gates.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/tox.ini#L11
https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/tools/run-bashate.sh

Related-Id: I2afa7931bf3e18798b95a8af33ccf5ef761c4ad5

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2ea2c1156e1b4de008f19e333e2740795dc406de

subject: Fix possible race condition when loading recent runs.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 20:44:54.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/controllers/job.js', 'app/js/controllers/grouped-runs.js'], 'message': 'Fix possible race condition when loading recent runs.

The list of recent runs currently is not initialized to its default
value until processData() has completed. If the request for recent
runs happens to finish first, it can throw an error when attempting
to modify the array. This moves the array initialization to the
beginning of the function, and allocates it directly in the request
handler to prevent the error from occurring.

Change-Id: Id8aec75d2233617322f9ac24fdb1904f0b46f846
'}]
commit_message:
Fix possible race condition when loading recent runs.

The list of recent runs currently is not initialized to its default
value until processData() has completed. If the request for recent
runs happens to finish first, it can throw an error when attempting
to modify the array. This moves the array initialization to the
beginning of the function, and allocates it directly in the request
handler to prevent the error from occurring.

Change-Id: Id8aec75d2233617322f9ac24fdb1904f0b46f846

subject: Revert "Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 15:10:35.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)"

assertFalse() is a weaker assertion than assertEqual(False, xxx),
because the former will allow None while the latter will not.

assertEqual is correct choice in a fair number of cases.

This reverts commit 7f00e710cf0ac2f0f9c18b058e3badbb7ec1c0cf.

Change-Id: I115964b3f8fa0fa6d1bb5787b70a61a14b254348
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)"

assertFalse() is a weaker assertion than assertEqual(False, xxx),
because the former will allow None while the latter will not.

assertEqual is correct choice in a fair number of cases.

This reverts commit 7f00e710cf0ac2f0f9c18b058e3badbb7ec1c0cf.

Change-Id: I115964b3f8fa0fa6d1bb5787b70a61a14b254348

commit_message:
Sets binding:profile to empty dic when unbinding port

When binding preexisting ports, direct/macvtap, nova
adds the binding:profile information. But when deleting
the VM, the port binding:profile information still kept.

This patch sets binding:profile to empty dic when unbinding it.

Closes-Bug: #1524643

Change-Id: I127e88a9bcdad44b795a245e566ab276de09fd82

commit_message:
Support `truncated` flag returned by keystone

Wrap a list of objects into custom class with additional attributes.

This is wanted by Horizon, that wants to know that the list returned
from keystone is not full and that more strict filters need to be
applied.

Change-Id: Icfabfd055aed1648dc4130b03ec3dbf9bad4e45a
Closes-Bug: 1520244

subject: Add search and filtering support to the timeline.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-12 20:28:51.000000000', 'files': ['app/views/directives/timeline-search-popover.html', 'app/js/directives/timeline.js', 'app/styles/directives/_timeline-overview.scss', 'app/js/directives/timeline-overview.js', 'app/views/directives/timeline.html', 'app/js/directives/timeline-search.js', 'app/js/filters/bootstrap-filters.js', 'app/styles/directives/_timeline-search.scss', 'app/js/directives/timeline-viewport.js', 'app/views/directives/timeline-details.html', 'app/views/timeline.html', 'app/styles/main.scss', 'app/views/directives/timeline-search.html', 'app/styles/directives/_timeline-viewport.scss'], 'message': 'Add search and filtering support to the timeline.

This adds a new UI for searching and filtering through tests in a
timeline. A new dropdown for filter options is added to the timeline
panel header, where users can query and select tests based on name and
metadata (pass/fail/skip). A list of results is displayed which can
be selected from directly, but results are also highlighted on the
timeline directly.

Some rearchitecting of the HTML layout for the timeline directive was
needed to allow part of the timeline to be inside a panel header, so
the entire panel layout was moved inside the timeline directive.
A new `filterFunction` field was added to the main timeline controller
to support communicating the filtering parameters to other components
of the timeline. Additionally, a new `contextClass` filter was added
to avoid excessive code duplication for highlighting element color
based on test status - existing uses were replaced with this.

Change-Id: I5f35091ab2b605e0821125e79de47c4c6067f644
'}]
commit_message:
Add search and filtering support to the timeline.

This adds a new UI for searching and filtering through tests in a
timeline. A new dropdown for filter options is added to the timeline
panel header, where users can query and select tests based on name and
metadata (pass/fail/skip). A list of results is displayed which can
be selected from directly, but results are also highlighted on the
timeline directly.

Some rearchitecting of the HTML layout for the timeline directive was
needed to allow part of the timeline to be inside a panel header, so
the entire panel layout was moved inside the timeline directive.
A new `filterFunction` field was added to the main timeline controller
to support communicating the filtering parameters to other components
of the timeline. Additionally, a new `contextClass` filter was added
to avoid excessive code duplication for highlighting element color
based on test status - existing uses were replaced with this.

Change-Id: I5f35091ab2b605e0821125e79de47c4c6067f644

subject: Redesign the timeline details panel.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-09 00:25:24.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/directives/timeline-viewport.js', 'app/views/directives/timeline-details.html', 'app/views/timeline.html', 'app/js/directives/timeline.js', 'app/js/directives/timeline-details.js'], 'message': 'Redesign the timeline details panel.

This redesigns the aspects of the timeline, particularly relating to
the details panel. First, selection mechanics are greatly simplified,
so items can be hovered while one is selected. Additionally, hovered
item names are now shown as part of the cursor. The details panel
now only shows details for selected items, and is moved to fill the
bottom of the screen; similarly, the timeline now fills the full width
of the screen.

Change-Id: I0acb88f898dcfd0a0327a38aa5eb995f118e1a1e
'}]
commit_message:
Redesign the timeline details panel.

This redesigns the aspects of the timeline, particularly relating to
the details panel. First, selection mechanics are greatly simplified,
so items can be hovered while one is selected. Additionally, hovered
item names are now shown as part of the cursor. The details panel
now only shows details for selected items, and is moved to fill the
bottom of the screen; similarly, the timeline now fills the full width
of the screen.

Change-Id: I0acb88f898dcfd0a0327a38aa5eb995f118e1a1e

commit_message:
Don't call add_ha_port inside a transaction

Calling add_ha_port inside a transaction will break the delete_port
error recovery logic. This patch prevents the scheduler from doing
that. It also adds a note to add_ha_port and a runtime check to
prevent the function from working with an active transaction.

Change-Id: I39e2bb70527a8ff4a47668f44abb81d0fede3786
Closes-Bug: #1529037

subject: Add setters for derived attributes to Atom (WIP)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-07 19:14:47.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/atom.py'], 'message': "Add setters for derived attributes to Atom (WIP)

Attributes that get derived from arguments passed
to the constructor cannot currently be changed after
the fact.  This is a somewhat hacky approach to the
problem in that the public API hasn't changed, but
setting any of the attributes re-computes the actual
values.  This lets you do stuff like:

atom = Task('mytask')
atom.provides = ['a', 'b']

And it works as expected.  'provides', 'requires', 'rebind',
and 'optional' all can now be set and work as expected.

Change-Id: I9a325fc91944b0ad406ab2e96137f306b8e732e8
"}]
commit_message:
Add setters for derived attributes to Atom (WIP)

Attributes that get derived from arguments passed
to the constructor cannot currently be changed after
the fact.  This is a somewhat hacky approach to the
problem in that the public API hasn't changed, but
setting any of the attributes re-computes the actual
values.  This lets you do stuff like:

atom = Task('mytask')
atom.provides = ['a', 'b']

And it works as expected.  'provides', 'requires', 'rebind',
and 'optional' all can now be set and work as expected.

Change-Id: I9a325fc91944b0ad406ab2e96137f306b8e732e8

commit_message:
Use pymysql database driver for OpenStack DBs

PyMySQL is a new driver introduced in Liberty.
This patch change the MySQL url to use mysql+pymysql like recommanded.

Closes-Bug: #1499298

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-17 12:20:01.000000000', 'files': ['monitoring/overview/templates/overview/index.html', 'README.md'], 'message': "Move Grafana to Apache's DocumentRoot

Static files are normally deployed with django's 'manage.py collectstatic'.
When run with --clear option, which seems to be default in some distributions
(e.g. RDO), all static resources are deleted first. Current Horizon integration
creates link to Grafana in static directory. Runing collectstatic --clear
leaves Grafana corrupted.

Proposed solution: Move Grafana to Apache's DocumentRoot.

also see: https://github.com/hpcloud-mon/ansible-monasca-ui/pull/6

Change-Id: Icbb2eecd45dfb1da48f63464ac83acb9e06cd71f
"}]
commit_message:
Move Grafana to Apache's DocumentRoot

Static files are normally deployed with django's 'manage.py collectstatic'.
When run with --clear option, which seems to be default in some distributions
(e.g. RDO), all static resources are deleted first. Current Horizon integration
creates link to Grafana in static directory. Runing collectstatic --clear
leaves Grafana corrupted.

Proposed solution: Move Grafana to Apache's DocumentRoot.

also see: https://github.com/hpcloud-mon/ansible-monasca-ui/pull/6

Change-Id: Icbb2eecd45dfb1da48f63464ac83acb9e06cd71f

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-18 19:37:57.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upload-swift-artifacts'], 'message': 'Add scripts/upload-swift-artifacts

This patch adds a new script/tool that can be used to upload
a set of file(s) into Swift. The tool automatically creates and
configures a Swift Temp URL in the undercloud and then generates
the required heat environment in $HOME/.tripleo/environments/ so that it
will automatically be used by heat deployments.

Change-Id: If63260e59ae44b172a76222d591d4e62d9432655
Implements: blueprint puppet-modules-deployment-via-swift
'}]
commit_message:
Add scripts/upload-swift-artifacts

This patch adds a new script/tool that can be used to upload
a set of file(s) into Swift. The tool automatically creates and
configures a Swift Temp URL in the undercloud and then generates
the required heat environment in $HOME/.tripleo/environments/ so that it
will automatically be used by heat deployments.

Change-Id: If63260e59ae44b172a76222d591d4e62d9432655
Implements: blueprint puppet-modules-deployment-via-swift

commit_message:
Pass version arg by name not position

Everyone except neutron has a first parameter called "version" - so we
can pass it by name. For neutron, add a workaround, becuase YAY people
being different.

Change-Id: Icfd92e5e31763ffccc1ff673298f89d1888941fe

commit_message:
Report discard support for Dell SC connections

Add reporting of discard in the properties returned from
initialize_connection. Dell SC arrays support trim/discard
with no special configuration needed, so this can always
be set to true.

Change-Id: Ib0136369e230b5219b2b3994d17b6b31a9aba69f

commit_message:
Only token or creds are required.

When token is provided and not the endpoint,
the client works, because keystoneauth/keystoneclient will
use the service_type to discover the endpoint.

Closes-bug: #1533712

subject: Handle absence of cinder default volume type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 05:41:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/volumes/views.py'], 'message': 'Handle absence of cinder default volume type

The code previously did not set the default_vol_type attribute if the
fetch of the default volume type failed (because none is declared in
the service). This patch defaults the attribute to the expected None
value, allowing volume creation to continue.

Change-Id: Ic9e14ae4cb23023a270ad4aec4e1a830a11215dd
Fixes-Bug: 1518844
'}]
commit_message:
Handle absence of cinder default volume type

The code previously did not set the default_vol_type attribute if the
fetch of the default volume type failed (because none is declared in
the service). This patch defaults the attribute to the expected None
value, allowing volume creation to continue.

Change-Id: Ic9e14ae4cb23023a270ad4aec4e1a830a11215dd
Fixes-Bug: 1518844

commit_message:
DVR: handle dvr serviceable port's host change

When a VM port's host is changed we need to check if a router
should be unscheduled from old host and send corresponding
notifications.
commit d5a8074ec3c67ed68e64a96827da990f1c34e10f added such
a check when port is unbound. This patch adds similar check
in case of host change (instance live migration)

Closes-Bug: #1508869

Conflicts:

	neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py

Change-Id: I57fa8253b2c88f7b7380a79b841fc424e9e52f19
(cherry picked from commit 189a6f1bc3295b719304f44e5b731ef671fe7f50)

subject: Fix a precedence problem with auth arguments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 18:45:48.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_config.py'], 'message': "Fix a precedence problem with auth arguments

With the current code, OS_TENANT_NAME will take precednece over
--os-project-name beause OS_TENANT_NAME gets early-moved to
config['auth']['project_name'], then when the argparse value gets put
into config['project_name'] the auth fixing sees auth['project_name']
and thinks it should win.

Change-Id: I97084ea221eb963f14d98cf550a04bbd5c7d954c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a precedence problem with auth arguments

With the current code, OS_TENANT_NAME will take precednece over
--os-project-name beause OS_TENANT_NAME gets early-moved to
config['auth']['project_name'], then when the argparse value gets put
into config['project_name'] the auth fixing sees auth['project_name']
and thinks it should win.

Change-Id: I97084ea221eb963f14d98cf550a04bbd5c7d954c

subject: Return empty dict instead of None for lack of file
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-13 17:35:20.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_config.py'], 'message': 'Return empty dict instead of None for lack of file

We return None for the file content for non-existent files as a
fallback. This is normally fine, but in the case of a person having
_only_ a secure.conf file, this means that the dictionary merge fails.

Change-Id: I61cc0a8c709ea3510428fc3dfce63dc254c07c83
'}]
commit_message:
Return empty dict instead of None for lack of file

We return None for the file content for non-existent files as a
fallback. This is normally fine, but in the case of a person having
_only_ a secure.conf file, this means that the dictionary merge fails.

Change-Id: I61cc0a8c709ea3510428fc3dfce63dc254c07c83

commit_message:
Add ConsistencyGroupStatus enum field

This change adds a new enum and field, ConsistencyGroupStatus and
ConsistencyGroupStatusField, that will hold the constants for the
'status' field of the ConsistencyGroup object. This enum and field
are based off the base oslo.versionedobjects enum and field. This
also changes over the ConsistencyGroup object to use the new field
(and bumps the version so newer versions know to enforce
valid values). Finally, all uses of strings for comparison and
assignment to this field are changed over to use the constants
defined within the enum.

Change-Id: Icee2727f0a550541876c63b6e7340acf3de553c8
Implements:  bp cinder-object-fields

commit_message:
Replaced the existing Dockerfiles. Tidied up Readme

I replaced the Dockerfiles that existed, which pulled anchor
down from git with a single Dockerfile that uses the local version
of anchor.

This makes testing local changes to anchor very simple.

I also updated the README to reflect these changes and fixed the
varying line lenghts within that file.

Change-Id: I313c840f594639e6c92ed6ff067da79652b74ed0

subject: Cap ansible < 2.0 for ansible-lint compatibility
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 17:57:09.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Cap ansible < 2.0 for ansible-lint compatibility

Currently ansible-lint does not support Ansible 2.0, which was
released yesterday afternoon.

This is being worked on in:
https://github.com/willthames/ansible-lint/issues/75

This patch caps Ansible to < 2.0 to allow the gate checks to
succeed. This patch can be reverted once ansible-lint supports

Change-Id: I4d7da77b0f42e33a4704fb44f1b993c0f1874647
'}]
commit_message:
Cap ansible < 2.0 for ansible-lint compatibility

Currently ansible-lint does not support Ansible 2.0, which was
released yesterday afternoon.

This is being worked on in:
https://github.com/willthames/ansible-lint/issues/75

This patch caps Ansible to < 2.0 to allow the gate checks to
succeed. This patch can be reverted once ansible-lint supports
Ansible 2.0 and above.

Change-Id: I4d7da77b0f42e33a4704fb44f1b993c0f1874647

commit_message:
Truncate docker-compose.yaml to zero bytes

Truncate docker-compose.yaml to zero bytes before writing the
updated config. Otherwise, if the existing config size is
more than the new config, trash is left behind.

Change-Id: I3d9628e53a4a100f333bab62fd775ab164179ec0

commit_message:
Add debug testenv in tox

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug -- --debug"
to debug test cases when tox is running.

Change-Id: Ic0635f2b99c166c77757277e8273f42cdb17ce73

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-01-11 18:24:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': "3PAR: Adding volume checks to manage snapshot API

Updated the checks in the HPE 3PAR manage snapshot API to use
the volume object for comparison. Also added new checks to
prevent un/managing of snapshots from/to volumes that have a
status of 'failed-over' for replication status.

This is a follow-up patch for:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/253760/

Implements: blueprint 3par-manage-unmanage-snapshot
Change-Id: Ie187e67d9eec2121d6ccad5667c6d9fc73f98ce3
"}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Adding volume checks to manage snapshot API

Updated the checks in the HPE 3PAR manage snapshot API to use
the volume object for comparison. Also added new checks to
prevent un/managing of snapshots from/to volumes that have a
status of 'failed-over' for replication status.

This is a follow-up patch for:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/253760/

Implements: blueprint 3par-manage-unmanage-snapshot
Change-Id: Ie187e67d9eec2121d6ccad5667c6d9fc73f98ce3

commit_message:
Add API method to get a list of recent runs by metadata

This commit adds a new rest api method to return a list of recent
runs for a given run_metadata key value pair. It will be useful in
constructing lists with links to recent runs.

Change-Id: Ic5557e42ab158b865c024dc539d291c061a69dce
Depends-On: I855c47e0056f459b1f71e919d0331c2e8ecbd3a8

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-16 20:36:03.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/load-image', 'scripts/overcloud_disk_images_docker.yaml', 'scripts/build-images', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh', 'scripts/setup-baremetal', 'scripts/devtest.sh'], 'message': 'Add support for using containers.

Adds a new argument to devtest.sh --use-containers which configures all
the necessary items to use a containerized compute node.  Note that you
must also set OVERCLOUD_DISK_IMAGES_CONFIG to
overcloud_disk_images_docker.yaml to make this work.

Change-Id: I392890e275a1b622c83325ac2ccee0cf3884b771
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for using containers.

Adds a new argument to devtest.sh --use-containers which configures all
the necessary items to use a containerized compute node.  Note that you
must also set OVERCLOUD_DISK_IMAGES_CONFIG to
overcloud_disk_images_docker.yaml to make this work.

Change-Id: I392890e275a1b622c83325ac2ccee0cf3884b771

subject: Fix ENABLED_SERVICES concat failure for stable branch jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 18:10:21.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/nodepool.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/heat.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/networking-ovn.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/rally.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/sahara.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix ENABLED_SERVICES concat failure for stable branch jobs

bc3a8eadd1cea099ef237ed498b11c0c65f34b79 removes the n-obj service
from jobs in master but keeps in the stable branch jobs. However,
several of the job definitions were not concatenating it correctly
on the stable branch definition so some services were not starting,
like n-net, which leads to very bad things on stable branch jobs.

Change-Id: I9f842b438f313691046afa5614203e1600c76b92
Closes-Bug: #1533777
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ENABLED_SERVICES concat failure for stable branch jobs

bc3a8eadd1cea099ef237ed498b11c0c65f34b79 removes the n-obj service
from jobs in master but keeps in the stable branch jobs. However,
several of the job definitions were not concatenating it correctly
on the stable branch definition so some services were not starting,
like n-net, which leads to very bad things on stable branch jobs.

Change-Id: I9f842b438f313691046afa5614203e1600c76b92
Closes-Bug: #1533777

Problem:
When we run nova client unit test, there are lots of UserWarnings

commit_message:
Test: Clean v2 client userwarning

Problem:
When we run nova client unit test, there are lots of UserWarnings
printed on the screen. These warnings mean to remind users not to
use v2.client directly.

Solution:
1. In top level tests such as some tests in test_auth_plugins.py
test_client.py and fixture_data/client.py, we use updated usage
novaclient.client instead of using novaclient.v2.client directly.
2. In v2 unit tests, we clean those warnings with setting direct_use
False.

Change-Id: I70682e54874860f1d67d29325811c9da616bb705
Closes-Bug: #1532711

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-01-07 17:08:00.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add a mechanism to call out deprecated options

We have had deprecated command line options in novaclient for a long
time, but no warnings about the deprecations were ever emitted, despite
the help text being suppressed.  It would be nice to finally get rid of
those deprecated options.  This change sets up the precondition to
accomplish this, by emitting appropriate warnings when a deprecated
option is used.

Note: The "use" text for the deprecated options has been deliberately
      chosen to reduce the number of translations required.

Change-Id: Ibe13faa56c5abca97f85f9c5172ef5a5591b5f71
'}]
commit_message:
Add a mechanism to call out deprecated options

We have had deprecated command line options in novaclient for a long
time, but no warnings about the deprecations were ever emitted, despite
the help text being suppressed.  It would be nice to finally get rid of
those deprecated options.  This change sets up the precondition to
accomplish this, by emitting appropriate warnings when a deprecated
option is used.

Note: The "use" text for the deprecated options has been deliberately
      chosen to reduce the number of translations required.

Change-Id: Ibe13faa56c5abca97f85f9c5172ef5a5591b5f71

commit_message:
Fix sysctl settings for amphora image

This patch fixes two things:
1. The sysctl settings were failing because some conntrack modules
were not loaded anymore.
2. I fixed the sysctl-set-value scripts to be able to handle
multi-value settings, such as tcp_rmem, in tripleo-image-elements[1].
Here I have removed the workaround we had in Octavia.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/134616/

Change-Id: Ib7ab4f487c1b792b70a110098bf7a28cb565ee55
Closes-Bug: #1527392

commit_message:
Use port 5016 by default

Reasons for change:
- keystone already uses port 5000

Reasons for the number:
- not present in services
- not used by anything else in openstack
- first above 5000 without any known / googleable services on the internet

Change-Id: I6d12f55a18269dd43be0fd4ef52b1817087b7fb6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 8124, 'name': 'cbrandily', 'email': 'zzelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'cbrandily'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 12929, 'name': 'Deliang Fan', 'email': 'vanderliang@gmail.com', 'username': 'DeliangFan'}, {'_account_id': 15843, 'name': 'Intel Hardware-Meters CI', 'email': 'ipmi-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'ipmici'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-08 02:05:12.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/api/ssl.py', 'etc/ceilometer/api_paste.ini', 'ceilometer/tests/api/test_ssl_middleware.py'], 'message': 'Add SSL middleware to fix incorrect version host_url

The Ceilometer API does not behave properly if it is behind an SSL
termination proxy. If this is the case, the host_url in version
resource are build using http protocol instead of https.

To handle to correct host_url with proxy, first, we should enable
X-Forwarded-Host in proxy so that Ceilometer can get the right client
ip. Second, we should enable X-Forwarded-Proto, with the new SSL
middleware, Ceilometer will get original protocol.

Change-Id: Ic25df94252e72504f987a9c326af12722b6c2b93
Closes-Bug: #1384379
'}]
commit_message:
Add SSL middleware to fix incorrect version host_url

The Ceilometer API does not behave properly if it is behind an SSL
termination proxy. If this is the case, the host_url in version
resource are build using http protocol instead of https.

To handle to correct host_url with proxy, first, we should enable
X-Forwarded-Host in proxy so that Ceilometer can get the right client
ip. Second, we should enable X-Forwarded-Proto, with the new SSL
middleware, Ceilometer will get original protocol.

Change-Id: Ic25df94252e72504f987a9c326af12722b6c2b93
Closes-Bug: #1384379

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-08 20:41:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_aggregates.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/aggregates.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/aggregates.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/objects/aggregate.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/pool.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Remove NovaObjectDictCompat from Aggregate

This change removes the NovaObjectDictCompat mixin from the Aggregate
versioned object. All occurrences of key access or get have been changed
to use getattr/setattr. Because none of the objects externally-facing
functionality has changed, the object version does not need to be
updated.

There was a fake aggregate in the xen api tests that contained two
empty dictionaries for a couple of keys in the metadata. These are actually strings in the
code, so they have been changed to empty strings.

Within the tests for the aggregate API, the fake dictionaries that were
returned by the AggregateAPI stubs were structured incorrectly. Within
the object, the availability zone is stored in the metadata dictionary,
not the top-level dictionary. Also, those dictionaries were changed to
Aggregate objects, so the stubs now return true objects (similar to how
the actual code works). The result of the calls are then compared by the
object primitives.

There was usage of .items() in _marshall_aggregate() within the api
controller for aggregates, so a unit test was added to run through that
function to make sure it is transforming the aggregate object correctly.
(props to Tempest for finding that one for me).

Partially-Implements: bp rm-object-dict-compat
Change-Id: Ibcb896b2eef673bce23491161ff394bcc87aa541
'}]
commit_message:
Remove NovaObjectDictCompat from Aggregate

This change removes the NovaObjectDictCompat mixin from the Aggregate
versioned object. All occurrences of key access or get have been changed
to use getattr/setattr. Because none of the objects externally-facing
functionality has changed, the object version does not need to be
updated.

There was a fake aggregate in the xen api tests that contained two
empty dictionaries for a couple of keys in the metadata. These are actually strings in the
code, so they have been changed to empty strings.

Within the tests for the aggregate API, the fake dictionaries that were
returned by the AggregateAPI stubs were structured incorrectly. Within
the object, the availability zone is stored in the metadata dictionary,
not the top-level dictionary. Also, those dictionaries were changed to
Aggregate objects, so the stubs now return true objects (similar to how
the actual code works). The result of the calls are then compared by the
object primitives.

There was usage of .items() in _marshall_aggregate() within the api
controller for aggregates, so a unit test was added to run through that
function to make sure it is transforming the aggregate object correctly.
(props to Tempest for finding that one for me).

Partially-Implements: bp rm-object-dict-compat
Change-Id: Ibcb896b2eef673bce23491161ff394bcc87aa541

subject: Constraints jobs non-voting for neutron-vpnaas
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 12:57:34.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Constraints jobs non-voting for neutron-vpnaas

This takes the experimental constraints based jobs and makes them
non-voting for non-Kilo release, as the next step in the process of
making these jobs available for master.

There are several additional changes and notes on this patch. First,
the unused experimental job, grenade-dsvm-neutron-vpnaas, was
previously remove. This commit removes the corresponding template,
and the lines to make this job non-voting.

Second, for non-Kilo branches, both non-constraint and constraint
jobs will run. In the next commit, when the constraints based jobs
are made voting, the non-constraints based jobs will only be run
for Kilo.

Third, the neutron-vpnaas-docs-constraints job is added to the
post queue. Currently, there is no docs job in the post queue
(e.g. no openstack-server-publish-jobs) for neutron-vpnaas. In the
next commit, openstack-server-publish-jobs-constraints will be
added for non-Kilo releases.

Fourth, the non-constraints coverage job will only run for Kilo
releases (the new constraints based job will run in post queue
for newer releases).

Change-Id: Ib131ca1686a78650a2e4be768746a83ed13307ee
Partial-Bug: #1522503
'}]
commit_message:
Constraints jobs non-voting for neutron-vpnaas

This takes the experimental constraints based jobs and makes them
non-voting for non-Kilo release, as the next step in the process of
making these jobs available for master.

There are several additional changes and notes on this patch. First,
the unused experimental job, grenade-dsvm-neutron-vpnaas, was
previously remove. This commit removes the corresponding template,
and the lines to make this job non-voting.

Second, for non-Kilo branches, both non-constraint and constraint
jobs will run. In the next commit, when the constraints based jobs
are made voting, the non-constraints based jobs will only be run
for Kilo.

Third, the neutron-vpnaas-docs-constraints job is added to the
post queue. Currently, there is no docs job in the post queue
(e.g. no openstack-server-publish-jobs) for neutron-vpnaas. In the
next commit, openstack-server-publish-jobs-constraints will be
added for non-Kilo releases.

Fourth, the non-constraints coverage job will only run for Kilo
releases (the new constraints based job will run in post queue
for newer releases).

Change-Id: Ib131ca1686a78650a2e4be768746a83ed13307ee
Partial-Bug: #1522503

commit_message:
os-brick add cinder local_dev lvm code

This patch adds the local LVM control code from Cinder into os-brick.
Nova has it's own copy of code that does basically the same thing.
This patch is the first step to migrating both Cinder and Nova to using
the same exact code for managing local lvm volume groups and volumes.
This is NOT a replacement for the Cinder lvm volume driver, but the
low level lvm management code.

Change-Id: I80a1ac859b9f3aa50262a8d0db750a00cb3e2dc4
implements blueprint: local-dev-lvm-to-os-brick

commit_message:
Fix floating IP status for HA router

Currently, FIP status is null when a FIP is associated with an
instance in an HA legacy router cloud.  This behavior blocks
any tempest tests that use FIPs due to a check of the FIP status
in setup.  This simple fix doesn't address comments raised in
its prior attempt but it is an improvement over leaving the current
null status behavior as it allows further validation of HA setups
via existing tempest tests.

Prior review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177777/

Change-Id: Ied41cfc108936839a6c177675d83ef4f709aa7c1
Closes-Bug: #1449049

subject: Fix fuel-agent crashes during ks_spaces validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 17:22:08.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/drivers/ks_spaces_validator.py'], 'message': 'Fix fuel-agent crashes during ks_spaces validation

fuel-agent validates pm_data.ks_spaces data structure to have a valid
schema, to be non-empty and to have a root partition less than 16T.

If it encounters a volume which does not have an assigned mountpoint
(could be an LVM PV) and at the same time is larger than 16T, it crashes
with a KeyError.

This change avoids a crash by using dict.get which does not throw an
exception in case a key is not present in the dict.

Change-Id: I34971f756d6b17c334dd5f7834af5ca778f2462a
Closes-Bug: 1526845
(cherry picked from commit 96a19bd7911a7c535078284acfe355b850fd4f24)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fuel-agent crashes during ks_spaces validation

fuel-agent validates pm_data.ks_spaces data structure to have a valid
schema, to be non-empty and to have a root partition less than 16T.

If it encounters a volume which does not have an assigned mountpoint
(could be an LVM PV) and at the same time is larger than 16T, it crashes
with a KeyError.

This change avoids a crash by using dict.get which does not throw an
exception in case a key is not present in the dict.

Change-Id: I34971f756d6b17c334dd5f7834af5ca778f2462a
Closes-Bug: 1526845
(cherry picked from commit 96a19bd7911a7c535078284acfe355b850fd4f24)

subject: set selinux as security_driver for RedHat OS family
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 14:29:04.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/spec/classes/openstack_compute_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/compute.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/roles/compute_spec.rb'], 'message': 'set selinux as security_driver for RedHat OS family

Currently Fuel puppet manifests set security_driver
in /ets/libvirt/qemu.conf as "none" on RedHat OS
family.
This patch sets security_driver value for RedHat OS
family to "selinux", this will allow to protect
vm guests from each other.
This patch does not affect Ubuntu compute nodes.

Change-Id: Iffaf2142fad25d3d50e05371fb53ab43f319c08a
Closes-bug: #1533286
(cherry picked from commit b5aa2d3b9fd65e92676e84c283f52097f6460eb2)
'}]
commit_message:
set selinux as security_driver for RedHat OS family

Currently Fuel puppet manifests set security_driver
in /ets/libvirt/qemu.conf as "none" on RedHat OS
family.
This patch sets security_driver value for RedHat OS
family to "selinux", this will allow to protect
vm guests from each other.
This patch does not affect Ubuntu compute nodes.

Change-Id: Iffaf2142fad25d3d50e05371fb53ab43f319c08a
Closes-bug: #1533286
(cherry picked from commit b5aa2d3b9fd65e92676e84c283f52097f6460eb2)

commit_message:
Use Fuel Master for NTP if no NTP servers specified

Nodes should sync time against Fuel Master if there are
no NTP servers specified. This also fixes a UI bug in Fuel
where the settings are invalid if there are no NTP servers.

Change-Id: I50422de29badf91c7739c011844609131173e34e
Partial-Bug: #1531185

commit_message:
Fix changing SSH credentials using SSHManager

Re-initialize SSHManager instead of updating connections
while changing credentials, because connections pool is
empty unless the default login/password is used.

Change-Id: I69f39e9920716c1046b9eb330c4675b13fe07a24
Closes-bug: #1532848

commit_message:
Fix service_type for Sahara

Currently we are using wrong service_type for Sahara, it was introduced
because of bug in Tempest in upstream during Kilo cycle and now
this bug is fixed and we should use proper service_type as well.

Change-Id: I890cf8bb8e15b568e72f42327c22ed4d852ea6e4

(cherry picked from commit fd9501197fd7e16dfb4ab85e919913924b4696b3)

commit_message:
Fixing PIPESTATUS usage

If we want to inspect PIPESTATUS, no immediately, we have make a local
copy of the same. Moreover, once copied we should use various stages
of the PIPESTATUS.

Change-Id: I9ba737c0e32daab714436b1b30589fbc5d0a766a
Closes-bug: #1532998

commit_message:
Implements proper UUID format for test_compute_mgr.

Currently some of the unittests are using non valid UUID format
for the FieldType UUID.

oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py.

Without this change adding validation will cause tests to fail.

Multiple etags can be provided on an if-match or if-none-match
request. This is currently being tested in the unit tests, but not
in the functional tests. Since these etags can be modified by
middleware, we need functional tests to assert multiple-etag
requests are handled correctly.

Change-Id: Idc409c85e8aa82b59dc2bc28af6ca2617de82699
'}]
commit_message:
Functional tests for if-match with multiple etags

Multiple etags can be provided on an if-match or if-none-match
request. This is currently being tested in the unit tests, but not
in the functional tests. Since these etags can be modified by
middleware, we need functional tests to assert multiple-etag
requests are handled correctly.

Change-Id: Idc409c85e8aa82b59dc2bc28af6ca2617de82699

subject: Fix a problem of memebrs not deleted from pool
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 17:18:18.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/controller/worker/flows/member_flows.py'], 'message': 'Fix a problem of memebrs not deleted from pool

Get_delete_member_flow original tasks order was:

1. DeleteModelObject
2. ListenerUpdate
3. DeleteMemberInDB
4. MarkLBAndListenerActiveInDB

Since memebrs are deleted from Listener only by DeleteMemberInDB,
ListenerUpdate is being called with all members (including the
member that should be deleted). The patch changes the order of
tasks. Calling DeleteMemberInDB before ListenerUpdate (i.e.
switch task 2 & 3) and thus the memebr is removed from HAProxy
List and info is updated to Amphorae as requested.

Change-Id: I159831ca13fc8864798972f75d4b0c6e1fcecf26
Closes-Bug: #1514510

Change call to DeleteMemberInDB to take member and not member_id

Change-Id: I41b3f04f442eb7a97551b49151b33b9089890eae
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a problem of memebrs not deleted from pool

Get_delete_member_flow original tasks order was:

1. DeleteModelObject
2. ListenerUpdate
3. DeleteMemberInDB
4. MarkLBAndListenerActiveInDB

Since memebrs are deleted from Listener only by DeleteMemberInDB,
ListenerUpdate is being called with all members (including the
member that should be deleted). The patch changes the order of
tasks. Calling DeleteMemberInDB before ListenerUpdate (i.e.
switch task 2 & 3) and thus the memebr is removed from HAProxy
List and info is updated to Amphorae as requested.

Change-Id: I159831ca13fc8864798972f75d4b0c6e1fcecf26
Closes-Bug: #1514510

Change call to DeleteMemberInDB to take member and not member_id

Change-Id: I41b3f04f442eb7a97551b49151b33b9089890eae

subject: Fix fuel-agent crashes during ks_spaces validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-30 08:57:31.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/drivers/ks_spaces_validator.py'], 'message': 'Fix fuel-agent crashes during ks_spaces validation

fuel-agent validates pm_data.ks_spaces data structure to have a valid
schema, to be non-empty and to have a root partition less than 16T.

If it encounters a volume which does not have an assigned mountpoint
(could be an LVM PV) and at the same time is larger than 16T, it crashes
with a KeyError.

This change avoids a crash by using dict.get which does not throw an
exception in case a key is not present in the dict.

Change-Id: I34971f756d6b17c334dd5f7834af5ca778f2462a
Closes-Bug: 1526845
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fuel-agent crashes during ks_spaces validation

fuel-agent validates pm_data.ks_spaces data structure to have a valid
schema, to be non-empty and to have a root partition less than 16T.

If it encounters a volume which does not have an assigned mountpoint
(could be an LVM PV) and at the same time is larger than 16T, it crashes
with a KeyError.

This change avoids a crash by using dict.get which does not throw an
exception in case a key is not present in the dict.

Change-Id: I34971f756d6b17c334dd5f7834af5ca778f2462a
Closes-Bug: 1526845

subject: Fail the introspection command if introspection has failed
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-12 12:09:32.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/baremetal/test_baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Fail the introspection command if introspection has failed

Currently it only prints an error message, but exists with success.
This makes it impossible to use this command in any kind of automated
scripts or test it in our gate. This patch makes it raise an exception.

Change-Id: I150c87252a48a8062aa7ef04c7a52433dd5ee37d
(cherry picked from commit ad470c343e4cafd975c8c313d04e762d47c32309)
'}]
commit_message:
Fail the introspection command if introspection has failed

Currently it only prints an error message, but exists with success.
This makes it impossible to use this command in any kind of automated
scripts or test it in our gate. This patch makes it raise an exception.

Change-Id: I150c87252a48a8062aa7ef04c7a52433dd5ee37d
(cherry picked from commit ad470c343e4cafd975c8c313d04e762d47c32309)

commit_message:
Drop support for specifying Template as URL

There's currently no need to specify custom templates
for action buttons when using the actions directive.
This will reduce some complexity in using the directive.

This patch may be reversed if the need arises in future.

Change-Id: I5eecf9841224151e1c046ffa4613e72cec476a14
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-23 18:38:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/utils.py'], 'message': 'Ironic: Lightweight fetching of nodes

The Ironic API version >= 1.8 supports fetching only a small number of a
resource instead of it's full representation. This patch is adding
support to the Nova Ironic driver to fetch only the fields it requires
when getting a node from Ironic's API.

This is important because the Nova Ironic driver does poll nodes when
perfoming state checks (i.e when the node is being spawned or
destroyed) and some nodes may even include a base64 string of the
configdrive in it. So being able to fetch only the fields we require for
the driver makes the logs easier to read and don't waste network
bandwidth with useless data.

To use this feature one should set the "api_version" configuration
option to 1.8 or higher in the Nova configuration file under the
"ironic" section.

Closes-Bug: #1458934
Change-Id: Ibb01a468db8434f25daa91eee9672f4dfcbe1c2f
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Lightweight fetching of nodes

The Ironic API version >= 1.8 supports fetching only a small number of a
resource instead of it's full representation. This patch is adding
support to the Nova Ironic driver to fetch only the fields it requires
when getting a node from Ironic's API.

This is important because the Nova Ironic driver does poll nodes when
perfoming state checks (i.e when the node is being spawned or
destroyed) and some nodes may even include a base64 string of the
configdrive in it. So being able to fetch only the fields we require for
the driver makes the logs easier to read and don't waste network
bandwidth with useless data.

To use this feature one should set the "api_version" configuration
option to 1.8 or higher in the Nova configuration file under the
"ironic" section.

Closes-Bug: #1458934
Change-Id: Ibb01a468db8434f25daa91eee9672f4dfcbe1c2f

commit_message:
Fix rgw_keystone_url for ceph-osd

When ceph-osd is installed on same node as radosgw, it reconfigures
rgw_keystone_url to public_ip:35357. Keystone doesn't listen on
public_ip:admin_port socket.

Closes-Bug: #1533578

Change-Id: I209d101f8ebf0a31119158fb6f37382ce8c6b4fe

subject: Prevent list pods while bay is not ready
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-12 02:53:58.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/tests/v1/test_pods_shell.py', 'magnumclient/tests/v1/shell_test_base.py', 'magnumclient/v1/pods_shell.py'], 'message': "Prevent list pods while bay is not ready

When bay is creating, pod-list will return:
$ magnum pod-list --bay k8sbay
ERROR: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'NoneType' and 'str' (HTTP 500)

The return message is useless and we should prevent this kind of usage
just like what we did in pod-create.
Added unit test for this.

Change-Id: Ia8eb30b5e54df9a8f48c71f63ceb9763ce7f385a
Closes-Bug: #1532144
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent list pods while bay is not ready

When bay is creating, pod-list will return:
$ magnum pod-list --bay k8sbay
ERROR: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'NoneType' and 'str' (HTTP 500)

The return message is useless and we should prevent this kind of usage
just like what we did in pod-create.
Added unit test for this.

Change-Id: Ia8eb30b5e54df9a8f48c71f63ceb9763ce7f385a
Closes-Bug: #1532144

commit_message:
config options: Centralise 'virt.hardware' options

Add options from 'virt.hardware'. These options are part of the
'DEFAULT' group but are included in the "nova.conf.virt" file in hope
that they can eventually be moved to their own group.

Change-Id: If2d75d628e484d406fb931dad8254d8be5cedc65

commit_message:
network: sync attach interface in order to handle concurrent reqs

This change prevents issue when concurrent reqs to attach interfaces
are executed. Commits set a lock to method attach_interface and before
any change to network info of an instance refresh its cache.

Change-Id: I498d2f158fd5837bddb6eacab0cab558529f7b38
Closes-bug: #1501735
Closes-bug: #1467581
Closes-bug: #1407664

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-08 17:15:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/base_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_neutron_security_groups.py', 'nova/compute/utils.py'], 'message': 'revert "Refresh instance info cache within lock"

Commit 0fb97014689b1b9575cafae88447db7f86ff4292 creates regression, it
was merged just after 3a850ac72d60b3823c5cb4a971eaf02c580a4a20 to fix
same issue but in a different way which was not optimal. Issue is a
race which can happen during boot time, it's not necessary to remove
benefice a cache by refreshing each time from database network
info where we can just ask Neutron when this race happen.

We do not have a way to fix this race, it happens during boot process
when event from neutron to populate database of networks is arriving
after we get network_info, so if network_info is empty when build
networks we ask Neutron to get fresh information about networks.

Related-bug: #1501735
Related-bug: #1467581
Related-bug: #1407664

Change-Id: Ia6a093c50e3b9b2d4dad68000ab0a9ccd8ef80bd
'}]
commit_message:
revert "Refresh instance info cache within lock"

Commit 0fb97014689b1b9575cafae88447db7f86ff4292 creates regression, it
was merged just after 3a850ac72d60b3823c5cb4a971eaf02c580a4a20 to fix
same issue but in a different way which was not optimal. Issue is a
race which can happen during boot time, it's not necessary to remove
benefice a cache by refreshing each time from database network
info where we can just ask Neutron when this race happen.

We do not have a way to fix this race, it happens during boot process
when event from neutron to populate database of networks is arriving
after we get network_info, so if network_info is empty when build
networks we ask Neutron to get fresh information about networks.

Related-bug: #1501735
Related-bug: #1467581
Related-bug: #1407664

Change-Id: Ia6a093c50e3b9b2d4dad68000ab0a9ccd8ef80bd

commit_message:
Change openstack_version to liberty-9.0

Since there is no coordinated release version anymore, use Fuel version number
and OpenStack release name to construct path to Fuel Library modules for the
current release.

Fuel-CI: disable

Change-Id: I13a78d5ea6d9e1b04fe835fcc4d0c22625efb7a3
Related-bug: 1503663
Depends-on: Ifef952e18f08b98c430bbff9434984deaa68df81

commit_message:
Add puppet header to interface config files

Now it is not understandable what is managed by puppet and what is not.
This patch adds header which marks puppet managed network config files.

Change-Id: Ieab97f550e26a5f8add0d3560999d68256415e74
Closes-bug: #1531458

subject: Remove redundant check after enforcing schema validation
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-06 17:53:43.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/federation/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_controller.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove redundant check after enforcing schema validation

check_immutable_params() turn out to be redundant since schema
validation that is enforce has the constraint that no additional
properties is allowed, any call with immutable params will be
caught by json schema.

The patch remove the check from controller and the relevant
testcases since the restful testcase will never get to the
call of the API actually.

The patch also remove the method check_immutable_params and
relevant testcases since it's not used anywhere.

Partially implements: bp schema-validation-extent

Change-Id: I017c14e4d1229951e389a9e8d48384b54e197dd3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant check after enforcing schema validation

check_immutable_params() turn out to be redundant since schema
validation that is enforce has the constraint that no additional
properties is allowed, any call with immutable params will be
caught by json schema.

The patch remove the check from controller and the relevant
testcases since the restful testcase will never get to the
call of the API actually.

The patch also remove the method check_immutable_params and
relevant testcases since it's not used anywhere.

Partially implements: bp schema-validation-extent

Change-Id: I017c14e4d1229951e389a9e8d48384b54e197dd3

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-12 22:32:26.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/enabled/_1051_project_ng_images_panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/app.module.js', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/material/templates/_header.html'], 'message': 'WIP Create a default Ng route

To use:
- Change local_settings.py CUSTOM_THEME_PATH = 'themes/material'
  This theme removes the target='_self' link on the openstack logo link
- Navigate to /project/ngimages
- Click openstack logo.

This "null" route on the top-level app allows for existing relative links
in header, sidebar and footer templates (or custom themes) to continue to
work, even when Angular HTML5 routing is enabled.

If the link requests a URL that doesn't match any currently registered
Angular routes, the "null" route reloads the page with the requested URL.
This gives Django a chance to evaluate the link to see if it has a template.

Without this change, any link that forgets to add 'target="_self"' will fail
to work with Angular routing enabled with puts a painful burden on
developers of new templates and owners of existing themes.

Change-Id: I74d9824f652e3cd0f6a9b9ab7b5e7fc5825ed4c7
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Create a default Ng route

To use:
- Change local_settings.py CUSTOM_THEME_PATH = 'themes/material'
  This theme removes the target='_self' link on the openstack logo link
- Navigate to /project/ngimages
- Click openstack logo.

This "null" route on the top-level app allows for existing relative links
in header, sidebar and footer templates (or custom themes) to continue to
work, even when Angular HTML5 routing is enabled.

If the link requests a URL that doesn't match any currently registered
Angular routes, the "null" route reloads the page with the requested URL.
This gives Django a chance to evaluate the link to see if it has a template.

Without this change, any link that forgets to add 'target="_self"' will fail
to work with Angular routing enabled with puts a painful burden on
developers of new templates and owners of existing themes.

Change-Id: I74d9824f652e3cd0f6a9b9ab7b5e7fc5825ed4c7

commit_message:
Refactor includes in the tables templates

Removes the includes from several tables in order to
increase performance as to not render the templates
10 times the number of items displayed

Also fixes a volume test that was checking for at
least 1 item matching but the check was done
for MORE than one item.

Change-Id: I5b81f3ea6c7a2d4688ea9e670930182190c84121
Implements: blueprint refactor-tables-templates

commit_message:
Add a generic and extensible way to describe the flow of actions

In watcher, an audit generates a set of actions which
aims at achieving a given goal (lower energy consumption, ...).
It is possible to configure different strategies in order to achieve
each goal. Each strategy is written as a Python class which produces
a set of actions. Today, the set of possible actions is fixed for a
given version of Watcher and enables optimization algorithms to
include actions such as instance migration, changing hypervisor state,
changing power state (ACPI level, ...).

This patchset propose a generic and extensible way to describe
the actions and his parameters that we want to add to Action Plan.
It also remove the static actions because they are now deprecated.

The documentation regarding strategy plugin need to be
updated (plugins.rst).

DocImpact
Partially implements: blueprint watcher-add-actions-via-conf

Change-Id: I3d641080e8ad89786abca79a942c8deb2d53355b

commit_message:
Add a dynamic loading of the Watcher Planner implementation

In watcher, an audit generates a set of actions which
aims at achieving a given goal (lower energy consumption, ...).
It is possible to configure different strategies in order to achieve
each goal. Each strategy is written as a Python class which produces
a set of actions. Today, the set of possible actions is fixed for a
given version of Watcher and enables optimization algorithms to
include actions such as instance migration, changing hypervisor state,
changing power state (ACPI level, ...).

The objective of this patchset is to give the ability to extend the
default set of planner algorithms currently available in Watcher
using Stevedore.

The doc need to explain how create a new planner.

DocImpact
Partially implements: blueprint watcher-add-actions-via-conf

Change-Id: I2fd73f8c4a457ee391d764a7a3f494deecd2634f

commit_message:
Add a common generic dynamic loader for watcher

In watcher, an audit generates a set of actions which
aims at achieving a given goal (lower energy consumption, ...).
It is possible to configure different strategies in order to achieve
each goal. Each strategy is written as a Python class which produces
a set of actions. Today, the set of possible actions is fixed for a
given version of Watcher and enables optimization algorithms to
include actions such as instance migration, changing hypervisor state,
changing power state (ACPI level, ...).

This patchset add a common generic dynamic loader for plugins,
such as for custom Actions, Strategies, Planners, etc.

Partially implements: blueprint watcher-add-actions-via-conf

Change-Id: I59d031b93865fff2540e3973921e1bdafa95f88e

subject: Pass environment variables of proxy to tox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 01:59:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed
even if environment variables of the proxy are set. This is
a new feature above tox 2.0, you can check it from [1].

This patch fix this problem.

[1]. https://tox.readthedocs.org/en/latest/example/basic.html#passing-down-environment-variables

Change-Id: Ia39279508094f303cf8235329cd4adbbf33c9966
'}]
commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed
even if environment variables of the proxy are set. This is
a new feature above tox 2.0, you can check it from [1].

This patch fix this problem.

[1]. https://tox.readthedocs.org/en/latest/example/basic.html#passing-down-environment-variables

Change-Id: Ia39279508094f303cf8235329cd4adbbf33c9966

commit_message:
Compare node groups in CDH plugin IMPALA validation

Because instances are not initialized during validation, compare node
groups instead. Using node group id beacuse NodeGroupReasouce is not
hashable for python set.

Change-Id: I3dd01c00d1efdaffdea1000913e4f650db72ff3a
Closes-bug: #1527533

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 15:17:46.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': "Don't die when yum fails.

Not all yum failures has to be considered
catastrofic failures also because install_package
function should implement the same behavior in Fedora,
CentOS and Ubuntu. Let return the error to be solved at higher
level.
Adjustment from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/263061/.

Co-Authored-By: Federico Ressi <federico.ressi@intel.com>

Change-Id: I41124c123579a19a281b8e7e02d787e53fac0602
Closes-Bug: #1522590

commit_message:
Don't die when yum fails.

Not all yum failures has to be considered
catastrofic failures also because install_package
function should implement the same behavior in Fedora,
CentOS and Ubuntu. Let return the error to be solved at higher
level.
Adjustment from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/263061/.

Co-Authored-By: Federico Ressi <federico.ressi@intel.com>

Change-Id: I41124c123579a19a281b8e7e02d787e53fac0602
Closes-Bug: #1522590

commit_message:
Fix bypass_url and errors with no headers

When using bypass_url the endpoint_override needs to be set in the
SessionClient.
Don't assume all responses have a Content-Type

Fixes Bug: 1532278
Change-Id: I5e1319aae28e16448e20dd2b41836341f3156c59

commit_message:
Set ha=False for Neutron router's creation

Creation of ha router require at least two l3 agents to be present.
As ostf tests can be run for one controller, set ha=False to prevent
failure.

Change-Id: Ibdc20ac9df9df1cfd9619792536cf1ee1833efcb

commit_message:
Disable execution of dbsync for Murano Dashboard

Since Horizon uses memcache as session engine in MOS,
we need to disable execution of dbsync for Murano Dashboard.

Closes-Bug: #1527478

commit_message:
Forbid changing of 'cluster_id' parameter for node group

Changing of 'cluster_id' for already existing node group may lead to
unexpected behavior of nodes added to that group.

Change-Id: Ifb89758b15762600ca907c75141b6e34e9058bcd
Closes-Bug: #1531512

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-06 13:23:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/io_util.py'], 'message': 'VMware: specify chunk size when reading image data

When reading OVA image data from Glance without specifying chunk size,
nova-compute tries to read the entire tar stream in memory because this
is how the tar fileobject is implemented. This patch fixes this by
specifying the chunk size to be 64KB.

Change-Id: I953dfa1c28c25886306e1c9afe281cf2faca4db5
Closes-Bug: #1495834
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: specify chunk size when reading image data

When reading OVA image data from Glance without specifying chunk size,
nova-compute tries to read the entire tar stream in memory because this
is how the tar fileobject is implemented. This patch fixes this by
specifying the chunk size to be 64KB.

Change-Id: I953dfa1c28c25886306e1c9afe281cf2faca4db5
Closes-Bug: #1495834

commit_message:
Fixing amqp/https terms

The AMQP/HTTPS terms in the security-guide didn't match up with the
glossary from openstack-manuals. This patch fixes those terms.

Change-Id: Id37d02ea34255fbf9e4e7c8b72e1e1aa65fa6bd0

commit_message:
Add info about the VMware MKS console

As of the Liberty release, the VMware nova compute driver supports
a native HTML5 console called MKS.  It's a secure alternative to
VNC.

Change-Id: Ie7c979dc094691a4de3fcb19f47e3daaac10aaa2

subject: Fix ClientException handling in Container Sync
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 11317, 'name': 'Eran Rom', 'email': 'eran@itsonlyme.name', 'username': 'eranr'}, {'_account_id': 12193, 'name': 'Hisashi Osanai', 'email': 'osanai.hisashi@jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'ho'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14766, 'name': 'Kazuhiro MIYAHARA', 'email': 'miyahara.kazuhiro@lab.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'miyahara'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-07 10:20:43.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-dispersion-report', 'test/unit/common/test_internal_client.py', 'swift/common/internal_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix ClientException handling in Container Sync

swift/container/sync.py uses swift.common.internal_client.delete_object
and put_object and expected these methods raise ClientException.
But delete_object and put_object never raise the exception so this patch
raises ClientException when urllib2 library raises HTTPError.

Co-Authored-By: Eran Rom <eranr@il.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1419901
Change-Id: I58cbf77988979a07998a46d9d81be84d29b0d9bf
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ClientException handling in Container Sync

swift/container/sync.py uses swift.common.internal_client.delete_object
and put_object and expected these methods raise ClientException.
But delete_object and put_object never raise the exception so this patch
raises ClientException when urllib2 library raises HTTPError.

Co-Authored-By: Eran Rom <eranr@il.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1419901
Change-Id: I58cbf77988979a07998a46d9d81be84d29b0d9bf

commit_message:
set selinux as security_driver for RedHat OS family

Currently Fuel puppet manifests set security_driver
in /ets/libvirt/qemu.conf as "none" on RedHat OS
family.
This patch sets security_driver value for RedHat OS
family to "selinux", this will allow to protect
vm guests from each other.
This patch does not affect Ubuntu compute nodes.

Change-Id: Iffaf2142fad25d3d50e05371fb53ab43f319c08a
Closes-bug: #1533286

subject: Add the possibility to store several parameters for an Action
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-01-13 08:25:25.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/tests/api/v1/test_actions.py', 'watcher/tests/db/utils.py', 'watcher/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'watcher/objects/action.py', 'watcher/api/controllers/v1/action.py'], 'message': 'Add the possibility to store several parameters for an Action

In watcher, an audit generates a set of actions which
aims at achieving a given goal (lower energy consumption, ...).
It is possible to configure different strategies in order to achieve
each goal. Each strategy is written as a Python class which produces
a set of actions. Today, the set of possible actions is fixed for a
given version of Watcher and enables optimization algorithms to
include actions such as instance migration, changing hypervisor state,
changing power state (ACPI level, ...).

This patchset add the possibility to store several parameters
for an Action.
The parameters store info that the custom Action needs.
The parameters provided as tuples with the following fields:
(parameter_name, parameter_type).

It remove also the deprecated attributes
(src,dst,description)

APIImpact
Partially implements: blueprint watcher-add-actions-via-conf

Change-Id: Ic6727341822f8ac62f212d337814b2dca76044e3
'}]
commit_message:
Add the possibility to store several parameters for an Action

In watcher, an audit generates a set of actions which
aims at achieving a given goal (lower energy consumption, ...).
It is possible to configure different strategies in order to achieve
each goal. Each strategy is written as a Python class which produces
a set of actions. Today, the set of possible actions is fixed for a
given version of Watcher and enables optimization algorithms to
include actions such as instance migration, changing hypervisor state,
changing power state (ACPI level, ...).

This patchset add the possibility to store several parameters
for an Action.
The parameters store info that the custom Action needs.
The parameters provided as tuples with the following fields:
(parameter_name, parameter_type).

It remove also the deprecated attributes
(src,dst,description)

APIImpact
Partially implements: blueprint watcher-add-actions-via-conf

Change-Id: Ic6727341822f8ac62f212d337814b2dca76044e3

commit_message:
Replace "suspend" with "destroy" in failover cases

Snapshot with error after suspending node contains suspended node
which will be starter after dos.py revert-resume.
"Destroy" should be used in this cases.

Change-Id: If5146412bc33a74f7f7196bf496d2760c73925a7
Closes-bug:#1532748

commit_message:
Delete checks for default domain delete

Currently defualt can not be deleted through update API.
There are checks in update_domain to prevent this.

This change deletes all checks and related tests for deleting
the default domain, including new default domain and old
default domain tests.

Change-Id: I31a9cd7ac8c394b38038343f85f405080ca5f915
Closes-Bug: 1522616

commit_message:
Install Murano artifact repository for Glance

This package adds a definition of murano-specific
artifact type, which acts as an extension of Glance
v3 API, enabling it to store, process and query
murano-specific artifacts. Since Glance uses stevedore
to discover its artifact types as plugins, this type
has to be installed into the same pythonic environment
with glance-api. When the v3 is disabled if glance-api
configuration, this package is not used.

This package can be used by another applications
(not only by Murano) that's why it should be always
installed (and shouldn't depend on Murano enablement).

Depends on:
https://review.fuel-infra.org/#/c/14675/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/259483

DocImpact

Change-Id: I48cf5f00d2c9fe9324bf3d6e91ce2adb9f9ea20e
Closes-bug: #1525289
(cherry picked from commit 7f7bad1a14e95f19e0f1c2ce67467c4d0491ffa8)

commit_message:
Provide integration test_hooks to be used in gate job

Using scripts inside horizon repo in test hooks we could not bother
infra folks each time when we need to do some change to test job.

The second part of the proposed change is to run these scripts at gate,
see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/263457/

Related-Bug: #1526791
Change-Id: Ic2d60df846e876530662046d75c3e56e7841ba30

is a dictionary of non-nullable fields.

Change-Id: I8b091432f76af117d0f8d303d8b6d53ad2ca8ba3

commit_message:
objects: update the old location parent_addr only if it has value

Do not update extra_update['phys_function'] in case parent_addr
field is None. Updating it leads to an exception as extra_update
is a dictionary of non-nullable fields.

Partially implements blueprint sriov-physical-function-passthrough

Change-Id: I8b091432f76af117d0f8d303d8b6d53ad2ca8ba3

commit_message:
Enable changing list of inspection collectors

Inspection collectors are IPA plugins that collect additional information
for inspection. This patch allow changing their list, with default remaining
the same (for now).

Change-Id: I1e5ea1cd5ee24872375cd53d3eebf14b1082d874

subject: Fix the wrong options in glance-api and glance-registry confs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 00:57:02.000000000', 'files': ['etc/glance-api.conf', 'etc/glance-registry.conf'], 'message': 'Fix the wrong options in glance-api and glance-registry confs

OSprofiler arguments do not have "profiler" group which makes
these config files wrong.

However they are used by DevStack, so this patch updates them
using:

   tox -e genconfig

Change-Id: Ia18ec3e7b2e94d0a0ba6cb8562a0b457fb5ef406
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the wrong options in glance-api and glance-registry confs

OSprofiler arguments do not have "profiler" group which makes
these config files wrong.

However they are used by DevStack, so this patch updates them
using:

   tox -e genconfig

Change-Id: Ia18ec3e7b2e94d0a0ba6cb8562a0b457fb5ef406

commit_message:
Clean up erroneous log messages

* Return false on network.inSameSubnet if any IP is None
* Improve menu highlighting to only target urwid.Button elements
  to avoid errors in logs
* Remove bootproto debug output in PXE Setup
* Improve wording about disabling NTP when there is no gateway

Change-Id: I521326e45a356211d067f45fa91d911964d9784b
Closes-Bug: #1528561

subject: Move Q_USE_SECGROUP for complete support of external plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-25 00:58:20.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/nec', 'lib/neutron_plugins/vmware_nsx_v3', 'lib/neutron_plugins/midonet', 'lib/neutron_plugins/vmware_nsx', 'lib/neutron_plugins/vmware_nsx_v', 'lib/neutron_plugins/vmware_dvs', 'lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': 'Move Q_USE_SECGROUP for complete support of external plugin

Even after devstack external plugin mechanism was introduced,
Neutron plugin maintainers still need to have small code
in the main devstack repo.
It is because has_neutron_plugin_security_group is called too
early, i.e. before loading external plugin.

This commit defers the call of has_neutron_plugin_security_group
until configure_neutron. After that, devstack external plugin
suport for Neutorn is completely achieved.

This patch also deletes vendor specific files which already use
external plugin (midonet, nec, vmware_*).
I checked all these repositories and confirmed they have
has_neutron_plugin_security_group function in their repo too.
We can safely delete these files.

Change-Id: If7b8f6fa674773ce131abb9b78fd392688c23254
'}]
commit_message:
Move Q_USE_SECGROUP for complete support of external plugin

Even after devstack external plugin mechanism was introduced,
Neutron plugin maintainers still need to have small code
in the main devstack repo.
It is because has_neutron_plugin_security_group is called too
early, i.e. before loading external plugin.

This commit defers the call of has_neutron_plugin_security_group
until configure_neutron. After that, devstack external plugin
suport for Neutorn is completely achieved.

This patch also deletes vendor specific files which already use
external plugin (midonet, nec, vmware_*).
I checked all these repositories and confirmed they have
has_neutron_plugin_security_group function in their repo too.
We can safely delete these files.

Change-Id: If7b8f6fa674773ce131abb9b78fd392688c23254

Add reviewing point related to REST API

Since I8ad9313f824ef656c841a9b60ee575f02ddea321, the api-wg has

commit_message:
Scheduler: enforce max attempts at service startup

The CFG module now supports min and max values. This is validated
when the configuration file is read. This change enables us to do
the validation of the 'scheduler_max_attempts' at init rather
than when an instance is being booted.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Id44fa9299d509a61f586e843cac485a00f2af032

commit_message:
Add xenapi support for XenapiLiveMigrateData objects

This makes the xenapi driver use an object for source, dest, and
pre-live migration checks. Like the libvirt patch before this,
actually tolerating an object in live_migration will come in a
following patch, because $reasons.

Note that this corrects the migration result of the fake xenapi
driver, which was returning a string instead of a dict, as the
real call would have.

Related to blueprint objectify-live-migrate-data

Change-Id: I0d5e9448ec782741ebec6fd67d2c8b01ebdafde1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-27 23:58:27.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_create_server.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_rescue.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_personality.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_servers.py', 'tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_attach_volume.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_rescue_negative.py'], 'message': 'Fix server admin password usage

Nova returns "adminPass" in create server response only if
CONF.enable_instance_password is True.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L688

Tempest-lib servers_client and its schema take care of those but in
tempest it is not taken care. Test case always expect "adminPass"
which is being further used for ssh etc.

If any environment has CONF.enable_instance_password as False then
attribute error will occur.

Test case should pass password while creating server and use that for
further usage instead of expecting admin password from create server
response.

Closes-Bug: #1528445

Change-Id: I745f3f8c0c8bee05db85af5e91fbb60b0a54bcec
'}]
commit_message:
Fix server admin password usage

Nova returns "adminPass" in create server response only if
CONF.enable_instance_password is True.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L688

Tempest-lib servers_client and its schema take care of those but in
tempest it is not taken care. Test case always expect "adminPass"
which is being further used for ssh etc.

If any environment has CONF.enable_instance_password as False then
attribute error will occur.

Test case should pass password while creating server and use that for
further usage instead of expecting admin password from create server
response.

Closes-Bug: #1528445

Change-Id: I745f3f8c0c8bee05db85af5e91fbb60b0a54bcec

commit_message:
Fix the password input

When validate the authentication after rebuild, the new password
should be used. And the paramiko lib will check both key pair or
user/password at the same time.

Change-Id: I5efd55de6552db8269f5efbbca1397e49d81547f
Closes-bug: #1530783

commit_message:
Fix service_type for Sahara

Currently we are using wrong service_type for Sahara, it was introduced
because of bug in Tempest in upstream during Kilo cycle and now
this bug is fixed and we should use proper service_type as well.

Change-Id: I890cf8bb8e15b568e72f42327c22ed4d852ea6e4
Closes-bug: #1356053

subject: Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-08 23:03:07.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb', 'Gemfile', 'spec/defaults.rb'], 'message': 'Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: I5e91cec849886e5320e1e2a264af66c5b8bfe95c
'}]
commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: I5e91cec849886e5320e1e2a264af66c5b8bfe95c
