[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-01-12 17:51:48.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/horizon/horizon_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/horizon/horizon.pp'], 'message': 'Fix horizon caching backend for UCA

This change updates the horizon caching backend to be configurable and
changes the default where os_package_default is either not present or is
set to debian. The MOS package provides an alternate memcache backend
that is not available from other groups. With this change, we can now
specify a cache_backend as part of the horizon configuration hash which
will be used instead of the defaults specified in code.

Change-Id: If1050db4bb54bc9f3ae355ffeb2ae7fbeb3cfc44
Related-Blueprint: deploy-with-uca-packages
'}]
commit_message:
Fix horizon caching backend for UCA

This change updates the horizon caching backend to be configurable and
changes the default where os_package_default is either not present or is
set to debian. The MOS package provides an alternate memcache backend
that is not available from other groups. With this change, we can now
specify a cache_backend as part of the horizon configuration hash which
will be used instead of the defaults specified in code.

Change-Id: If1050db4bb54bc9f3ae355ffeb2ae7fbeb3cfc44
Related-Blueprint: deploy-with-uca-packages

commit_message:
Upgrade requirements for compatibility with Keystone

In order to have the monasca client as part of the global requirements
all the packages conflicts need to be resolved.

Keystone is using a new version of oslo.util and monasca client
has to adopt it too.

Change-Id: I55f827ec3e922dfdd4dcaeb2d43762465421f1fa

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 18:51:32.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/api.py'], 'message': "Sometimes prepare messages are delayed

This bug addresses one issue which manifests itself as a delayed
deliver of prepare messages on the guest. A full description of the
change is found in the bug report along with a set of sample programs
to recreate the problem and test the fix.

I'm marking this as 'partial-bug' only because I'm not sure this is
the only issue that can cause this. It is just that this one is
certainly the one that has been plaguing me on my dev environment.

Change-Id: I065fb7c7f674ce587d4a480ac2f3462826ba2604
Partial-Bug: #1511623
"}]
commit_message:
Sometimes prepare messages are delayed

This bug addresses one issue which manifests itself as a delayed
deliver of prepare messages on the guest. A full description of the
change is found in the bug report along with a set of sample programs
to recreate the problem and test the fix.

I'm marking this as 'partial-bug' only because I'm not sure this is
the only issue that can cause this. It is just that this one is
certainly the one that has been plaguing me on my dev environment.

Change-Id: I065fb7c7f674ce587d4a480ac2f3462826ba2604
Partial-Bug: #1511623

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-08 17:40:09.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_resource.py', 'keystone/resource/core.py'], 'message': 'Disallow disabling the default domain

Currently default domain can be disabled through domain update API.
There is nothing in the update domain flow that protects against
disabling the default domain.

This change checks that default domain can not be disabled.
Test cases include checking disabling default domain, any new default domain,
and old default domain.

Change-Id: I918841af87f23ea7eedc788ff7a4e0d6ac64ed00
Closes-Bug: 1522616
'}]
commit_message:
Disallow disabling the default domain

Currently default domain can be disabled through domain update API.
There is nothing in the update domain flow that protects against
disabling the default domain.

This change checks that default domain can not be disabled.
Test cases include checking disabling default domain, any new default domain,
and old default domain.

Change-Id: I918841af87f23ea7eedc788ff7a4e0d6ac64ed00
Closes-Bug: 1522616

commit_message:
UI: Enable CSS use in mistral dashboard

* Removed non-working implementation of LESS (scss to css compiler)
* Removed redundant unused styles
* Added CSS support - the same way they do in Murano Dashboard
* We could always add LESS and Django intergration later,
  seems it only works in static folders inside the Horizon respository ATM.

Closes-Bug: 1512377

Change-Id: Ic1f239c103382e780df754ff8fac4b6374ef33cb

subject: Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-08 16:57:54.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb', 'Gemfile', 'spec/defaults.rb'], 'message': 'Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: Id6357ffb1a47ea78760e4af181da3797d7ec8fe8
'}]
commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: Id6357ffb1a47ea78760e4af181da3797d7ec8fe8

  writer plugin to publish telemetry to ceilometer.
- This plugin will utilise the collectd python plugin

- This repository will be extended to provide in tree

Change-Id: I33c077ae3b52a63f60980ebf757c51e3f41abd82
'}]
commit_message:
Opening a repository for a ceilometer plugin for collectd.

- This change creates a new repo to host a collectd
  writer plugin to publish telemetry to ceilometer.
- This plugin will utilise the collectd python plugin
  interface to integrate with collectd.
- This repository will be extended to provide in tree
  documentation and devstack integration.

Change-Id: I33c077ae3b52a63f60980ebf757c51e3f41abd82

commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: I977b9f2fd1558d45128d8a0bd161faba982dda4e

subject: Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-08 22:50:43.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb', 'Gemfile', 'spec/defaults.rb'], 'message': 'Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: Id4f384ab9e50c0cf9fe638cab50374c21844ca36
'}]
commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: Id4f384ab9e50c0cf9fe638cab50374c21844ca36

commit_message:
Only implement br_netfilter module for kernels above version 3.18

The br_netfilter kernel module is only available for kernels above 3.18.
This patch implements a check for the kernel version and only adds that
module if the current kernel is at the correct version or above.

Change-Id: I608ed30cbd25380863febac5383d93e384689251

subject: Remove temporary path for Puppet modules
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-12-29 19:46:02.000000000', 'files': ['specs/fuel-library9.0.spec'], 'message': "Remove temporary path for Puppet modules

Storing Puppet modules to /etc/puppet/2015.1.0-8.0 directory was required to
pass the Fuel CI gate before corresponding change is merged in
openstack/fuel-web. Since version updated in openstack.yaml file in
openstack/fuel-web, this directory is no longer needed.

Don't copy Puppet modules to /etc/puppet/2015.1.0-8.0 directory.
Don't delete directory with modules for the specific release.

Change-Id: I2437519bed18dffe67b08aca8251daf055136db8
Related-bug: 1508572
Depends-on: b8705f61b5a65972922e6375f8b2a28f64ede813
"}]
commit_message:
Remove temporary path for Puppet modules

Storing Puppet modules to /etc/puppet/2015.1.0-8.0 directory was required to
pass the Fuel CI gate before corresponding change is merged in
openstack/fuel-web. Since version updated in openstack.yaml file in
openstack/fuel-web, this directory is no longer needed.

Don't copy Puppet modules to /etc/puppet/2015.1.0-8.0 directory.
Don't delete directory with modules for the specific release.

Change-Id: I2437519bed18dffe67b08aca8251daf055136db8
Related-bug: 1508572
Depends-on: b8705f61b5a65972922e6375f8b2a28f64ede813

commit_message:
Explicitly install `ceph-mds` package

When Manila is to be configured with CephFS backend, explicitly
install `ceph-mds` package. The newer versions of Ceph packages,
do not have the dependency between `ceph` and `ceph-mds` packages.

Change-Id: Idfd4cf7fc017ad6ced2d325356ff97cc68889dc0
Closes-Bug: #1533314

commit_message:
Remove fallback to simplejson in jsonutils

OpenStack has ended support for Python 2.6 in all services and
libraries. We no longer need to support a fallback to simplejson on
Python 2.6 so we can remove this fallback logic.

Closes-bug: 1533337
Change-Id: I613541a37229ff2f3ce269cfa7496223d1ff37d0

revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2016-01-08 21:07:53.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/cinder-backend-report-discard-1def1c28140def9b.yaml', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/volume.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_volume.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: add discard support for attached volumes

If Cinder reports discard=true capability then add
discard=unmap to disk config setting on attached volume.

To have this actually provide unmap/trim support the instance must have
been configured with a controller+bus type that can support it. As of
now the only one known not to work is virtio-blk. In the case where we
detect a configuration that will not work a warning will be logged, but
the attachment will continue with the default behavior.

An example of how to get a controller and bus to support this is to set
the following Glance properties on an image:

hw_scsi_model=virtio-scsi
hw_disk_bus=scsi

This feature also has some requirements for the libvirt and qemu
versions being used. There is a check to ensure that libvirt is at least
1.0.6 and qemu is at least 1.6.0. If the minimum versions are not met
a warning will be logged, but the attachment will continue with the
default behavior.

Change-Id: Icd2d20bb6906d9106df34a970b3d81b17bc3ec07
Implements: bp cinder-backend-report-discard
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: add discard support for attached volumes

If Cinder reports discard=true capability then add
discard=unmap to disk config setting on attached volume.

To have this actually provide unmap/trim support the instance must have
been configured with a controller+bus type that can support it. As of
now the only one known not to work is virtio-blk. In the case where we
detect a configuration that will not work a warning will be logged, but
the attachment will continue with the default behavior.

An example of how to get a controller and bus to support this is to set
the following Glance properties on an image:

hw_scsi_model=virtio-scsi
hw_disk_bus=scsi

This feature also has some requirements for the libvirt and qemu
versions being used. There is a check to ensure that libvirt is at least
1.0.6 and qemu is at least 1.6.0. If the minimum versions are not met
a warning will be logged, but the attachment will continue with the
default behavior.

Change-Id: Icd2d20bb6906d9106df34a970b3d81b17bc3ec07
Implements: bp cinder-backend-report-discard

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-22 12:34:08.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst', 'ReleaseNotes'], 'message': 'Move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst

For now, we have added reno for release notes management, and a folder
"releasenotes" was added in aodh. Because there is a file named
"ReleaseNotes" to provide release note location and aodh home, it will
broken some git operations in case insensitive OS (e.g. Windows).
This change simply move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst to avoid
the problem.

Change-Id: I30ea4a5d8cb4450ca76ec5e834ccf07cd996de77
(cherry picked from commit 2a01d67152b3ea19d72616f646a262a0df258b56)

commit_message:
Move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst

For now, we have added reno for release notes management, and a folder
"releasenotes" was added in aodh. Because there is a file named
"ReleaseNotes" to provide release note location and aodh home, it will
broken some git operations in case insensitive OS (e.g. Windows).
This change simply move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst to avoid
the problem.

Change-Id: I30ea4a5d8cb4450ca76ec5e834ccf07cd996de77
(cherry picked from commit 2a01d67152b3ea19d72616f646a262a0df258b56)

commit_message:
Make volume snapshots_client to use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes volume snapshots_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I1fc18a879702a2f77ebbe704fa2e9c5eaa96b220

commit_message:
Add support for ip_version on AddressScope create

Address scopes must now be created with an explicit ip_version.
This patchenables ip_version to be passed on the neutron CLI.

Change-Id: Iee902e1539d2bc0cb03c24f483ab7bab8b6a657e
Depends-On: Ibc6de08e0ef58a5da954d13f274f6003012a76cd
Partially-Implements: blueprint address-scopes

commit_message:
Sync IP addresses with Installation Guides

* change controller virtual IP to controller IP in install guides.
* use controller virtual IP as database IP address to sync.
* use controller virtual IP as messaging service IP address to sync.
* use controller virtual IP as storage node IP address
  instead of using standalone storage nodes to keep current contents.
* don't update any other contents, just change IP addresses.

Change-Id: Ibae9143142414fbec924d30ffa39dc0d51bb7411
Closes-Bug: #1529548

subject: Fix putting containers behavior during migration of accounts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 06:02:25.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py'], 'message': "Fix putting containers behavior during migration of accounts

A request for putting container comes during migration of accounts.
The putting container updates own info to account servers but there
is no account in the server because it's migrating and not finished
yet. In this case the putting container gets 404.

If number of replicas is even number and half of accounts are
migrating, new requests for putting container are NOT success.
The internal statuses are 201 and 404 so the response code will
be 503.

This patch overrides 404 status in the case with 201 so new requests
for putting container will be succeeded.

Swift recommends number of replicas is odd number but some deployers
use even number because of combination with SDS products.

Change-Id: I2210dea35a128eba722d57cebf3d1cc2cdc23b47
"}]
commit_message:
Fix putting containers behavior during migration of accounts

A request for putting container comes during migration of accounts.
The putting container updates own info to account servers but there
is no account in the server because it's migrating and not finished
yet. In this case the putting container gets 404.

If number of replicas is even number and half of accounts are
migrating, new requests for putting container are NOT success.
The internal statuses are 201 and 404 so the response code will
be 503.

This patch overrides 404 status in the case with 201 so new requests
for putting container will be succeeded.

Swift recommends number of replicas is odd number but some deployers
use even number because of combination with SDS products.

Change-Id: I2210dea35a128eba722d57cebf3d1cc2cdc23b47

commit_message:
Var name can not be python keyword

python keyword "type" should not be used as a variable name,
replace it with "volume_type".

Change-Id: I0e96e769c9a8e593f37a5a6fc75be0583822210e
Implements: PEP8 on variable name
Closes-Bug: #1532567

commit_message:
Remove use of ansible_ssh_port

The use of ansible_ssh_port is deprecated in Ansible 2. Explicitly check port 22 in
the lxc_containers_create playbook to avoid using ansible_ssh_port and
to be consistent with all of the other playbooks.

Change-Id: I17f00f2977c8e8ad3a3e15e2083f8f22e525e1b9

commit_message:
[Gates] Avoid duplication in logging

If you take a look, for example, at this log file [1], you will see that
log messages are duplicated. So this patch is intended to fix this issue.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/97/266297/1/check/gate-rally-dsvm-verify-light/b2e9c40/console.html#_2016-01-12_11_46_41_956

Change-Id: Ibf4823ca6b1d690074766b9cb7a04ca40543eabc

present.

subject: Update Watcher Tempest tests package name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 15:21:48.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/watcher.yaml'], 'message': "Update Watcher Tempest tests package name

As specified in
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/plugin.html, the
name of the tempest tests package should be of the format
'{{name}}_tempest_plugin'. So this patchset is here to enforce
this rule.

Change-Id: I93b3e39f1f83a04a25da1bcb97e6d6ec12c1df14
"}]
commit_message:
Update Watcher Tempest tests package name

As specified in
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/plugin.html, the
name of the tempest tests package should be of the format
'{{name}}_tempest_plugin'. So this patchset is here to enforce
this rule.

Change-Id: I93b3e39f1f83a04a25da1bcb97e6d6ec12c1df14

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 7293, 'name': 'Elena Ezhova', 'email': 'ezhovaelena19@gmail.com', 'username': 'elena'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 14358, 'name': 'Marian Horban', 'email': 'm.horban@gmail.com', 'username': 'mhorban'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-12 14:31:24.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_service/service.py', 'oslo_service/tests/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Graceful shutdown added to ServiceLauncher

Signal handlers were changed:
SIGTERM - causes graceful shutdown,
SIGINT - instantaneous shutdown.

Tests for handling signals by ServiceLauncher were added.

Closes-Bug: #1446583
Change-Id: Idccee004547b0eb905c484538d6510c8315c210f
'}]
commit_message:
Graceful shutdown added to ServiceLauncher

Signal handlers were changed:
SIGTERM - causes graceful shutdown,
SIGINT - instantaneous shutdown.

Tests for handling signals by ServiceLauncher were added.

Closes-Bug: #1446583
Change-Id: Idccee004547b0eb905c484538d6510c8315c210f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-08 09:00:13.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'message': 'Removes MANIFEST.in as it is not needed explicitly by PBR

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a sensible
manifest from git files and some standard files and it removes
the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I2d36c99162b24369e5e20e643a8a68a25765b3f6
'}]
commit_message:
Removes MANIFEST.in as it is not needed explicitly by PBR

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a sensible
manifest from git files and some standard files and it removes
the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I2d36c99162b24369e5e20e643a8a68a25765b3f6

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 10:51:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vm_util.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py'], 'message': 'VMware: treat cases where network does not exist on host

There are edge cases when the actual network for the host is not
yet created and the instance is trying to access that network.

This will resuly in an exception of the form:
"VimFaultException: Invalid configuration for device '0'.
 Faults: ['InvalidDeviceSpec']"

This patch will enable a retry giving the system time to actually
create the network on the host.

A work around for this would be to increse the amount of scheduling
attempts and to remove the RetryFilter from the default filter list.

That will be problematic when working in a hybrid environemtn.

Change-Id: I38e010ac4825fba424160e6a4e183ecb1ab86dfb
Closes-bug: #1532750
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: treat cases where network does not exist on host

There are edge cases when the actual network for the host is not
yet created and the instance is trying to access that network.

This will resuly in an exception of the form:
"VimFaultException: Invalid configuration for device '0'.
 Faults: ['InvalidDeviceSpec']"

This patch will enable a retry giving the system time to actually
create the network on the host.

A work around for this would be to increse the amount of scheduling
attempts and to remove the RetryFilter from the default filter list.

That will be problematic when working in a hybrid environemtn.

Change-Id: I38e010ac4825fba424160e6a4e183ecb1ab86dfb
Closes-bug: #1532750

subject: Adds an explicit utils import in test_v3_protection.py
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-12 21:37:59.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_protection.py'], 'message': 'Adds an explicit utils import in test_v3_protection.py

This sometimes causes order of operations issues with different test runners,
like nose. The fix is to import keystone.tests.unit.utils directly instead of

Change-Id: I1f92fcbedd13b5decac8da0d58f1286d03088473

commit_message:
Adds an explicit utils import in test_v3_protection.py

This sometimes causes order of operations issues with different test runners,
like nose. The fix is to import keystone.tests.unit.utils directly instead of
relying on it being resolved from keystone.tests.unit.

Change-Id: I1f92fcbedd13b5decac8da0d58f1286d03088473

revisions:

This commit starts the deprecation timer on the javelin utility and
adds a deprecation on stdout when the command is invoked. We stopped
using it in the upstream gate when grenade was refactored as part of
adding the plugin interface. We'll remove it from the tempest tree

Change-Id: Ie4ab5258946271a16e96a070abeedfafa5423714

commit_message:
Mark Javelin as deprecated

This commit starts the deprecation timer on the javelin utility and
adds a deprecation on stdout when the command is invoked. We stopped
using it in the upstream gate when grenade was refactored as part of
adding the plugin interface. We'll remove it from the tempest tree
after a standard deprecation window has elapsed.

Change-Id: Ie4ab5258946271a16e96a070abeedfafa5423714

Base enablement for memory bandwidth monitor

This patch introduces two new methods in the driver base class
that will be used for determining the memory bandwidth of a given
host node.

The patch also introduces a base class for the Memory Bandwidth
monitor.

subject: generator: ignore doubles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-07 16:54:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_generator.py', 'oslo_config/generator.py'], 'message': "generator: ignore doubles

There could be cases that a consuming project lists its config
options multiple times for the sample config file generation.
The result is that these config options get emitted multiple times
in the sample file. The generator didn't recognize this.

This commit removes the doubles from the read listings. The generator
will emit each config option (in a group in a namespace) only once.

Change-Id: Ifadc0b260ed6ab686131ac06ef74cf1f5b3dfe71
"}]
commit_message:
generator: ignore doubles

There could be cases that a consuming project lists its config
options multiple times for the sample config file generation.
The result is that these config options get emitted multiple times
in the sample file. The generator didn't recognize this.

This commit removes the doubles from the read listings. The generator
will emit each config option (in a group in a namespace) only once.

Change-Id: Ifadc0b260ed6ab686131ac06ef74cf1f5b3dfe71

revisions:

Change-Id: I0da5987a2f295ba8b2f10a0349add4d21ab29ab5
(cherry picked from commit 4c59a98299901a4b48b4938753574abca6306c88)

commit_message:
Fix gnocchi resource update without change

When use "gnocchi update resource <resource_id>" command to update a
resource without any attribute change, a KeyError will be returned,
because the resource metrics won't be returned if no attribute updated.

Change-Id: I0da5987a2f295ba8b2f10a0349add4d21ab29ab5
(cherry picked from commit 4c59a98299901a4b48b4938753574abca6306c88)

subject: Add periodics.is_periodic to check if object is a periodic task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-06 16:16:42.000000000', 'files': ['futurist/periodics.py', 'futurist/tests/test_periodics.py'], 'message': 'Add periodics.is_periodic to check if object is a periodic task

People implementing their own periodic tasks collection (as opposed
to using PeriodicWorker.create) need to know if something is
a periodic task without inspecting its private attributes.
This function returning True means something is safe to add
to a PeriodicWorker (will not raise ValueError).

Change-Id: Iee8da601b1bc994188c58ca459574a466270bf63
'}]
commit_message:
Add periodics.is_periodic to check if object is a periodic task

People implementing their own periodic tasks collection (as opposed
to using PeriodicWorker.create) need to know if something is
a periodic task without inspecting its private attributes.
This function returning True means something is safe to add
to a PeriodicWorker (will not raise ValueError).

Change-Id: Iee8da601b1bc994188c58ca459574a466270bf63

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 04:10:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/fixture.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Stop using private keystoneclient functions"

This reverts commit 96f6668a27c34c7fd49c8a0df160c0789b0aa6ba.

Whilst in theory I agree we don't want to expose this many positional
arguments. This is exactly what positional is supposed to be used for.

I'm happy to have the debate as to where we can make @positional

Change-Id: Idd07e49370597b63c0e49b56843266a7014a0e65
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Stop using private keystoneclient functions"

This reverts commit 96f6668a27c34c7fd49c8a0df160c0789b0aa6ba.

Whilst in theory I agree we don't want to expose this many positional
arguments. This is exactly what positional is supposed to be used for.

I'm happy to have the debate as to where we can make @positional
publically available from but for now (and follow up patch) let's keep
it.

Change-Id: Idd07e49370597b63c0e49b56843266a7014a0e65

subject: Refactor openstack-network: move ml2 plugin into server-config.pp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 12:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-network/server-config.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/plugins/ml2_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-network/plugins/ml2.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/server-config_spec.rb'], 'message': "Refactor openstack-network: move ml2 plugin into server-config.pp

Currently openstack-network-server-config task is not idempotent - it
unconditionally stops the neutron-server service upon invocation relying
on plugins/ml2.pp to bring it up once the plugin config is materialized.

This patch refactors openstack-network/{server-config,plugins/ml2}.pp so
the plugin configuration is now an essential part of server-config.pp.
It should make sense - anyway, you can't start neutron without a plugin

Change-Id: Ifbe43af789087dad9e2f186436b22e9a8e1d4a1d
Closes-Bug: 1526677
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor openstack-network: move ml2 plugin into server-config.pp

Currently openstack-network-server-config task is not idempotent - it
unconditionally stops the neutron-server service upon invocation relying
on plugins/ml2.pp to bring it up once the plugin config is materialized.

This patch refactors openstack-network/{server-config,plugins/ml2}.pp so
the plugin configuration is now an essential part of server-config.pp.
It should make sense - anyway, you can't start neutron without a plugin

Change-Id: Ifbe43af789087dad9e2f186436b22e9a8e1d4a1d
Closes-Bug: 1526677

subject: Added Keystone and RequestID headers to CORS middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-08 18:38:06.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/api/app.py'], 'message': "Added Keystone and RequestID headers to CORS middleware

CORS middleware's latent configuration feature allows adding
headers that apply to all valid origins. This patch adds headers
commonly used in openstack to magnum's middleware initializtion,
so that operators do not have to be aware of additional
configuration magic to ensure that browsers can talk to the API.

For more information:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html

Change-Id: Ia253a08f42fc8fe85bf42e5dabb215c01f155150
"}]
commit_message:
Added Keystone and RequestID headers to CORS middleware

CORS middleware's latent configuration feature allows adding
headers that apply to all valid origins. This patch adds headers
commonly used in openstack to magnum's middleware initializtion,
so that operators do not have to be aware of additional
configuration magic to ensure that browsers can talk to the API.

For more information:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html

Change-Id: Ia253a08f42fc8fe85bf42e5dabb215c01f155150

In DVR case we only need to notify the l3 agent on compute node
where associated fixed port is located.

(cherry picked from commit eef7990e8a51bce7543d0bf602324051394ebccc)

subject: Call _allocate_vr_id outside of transaction
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 13:12:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': "Call _allocate_vr_id outside of transaction

_allocate_vr_id is called from _set_vr_id, which was starting a
transaction before calling it. This caused an error when the retry
logic was triggered inside of _allocate_vr_id since it would
encounter a DB exception and put the transaction into a bad state
that couldn't be used on the retry.

This patch just stops _set_vr_id from starting a transaction because
it didn't serve a purpose. It also stops _allocate_vr_id from allowing
subtransactions when it starts a transaction, since it's retry logic
isn't compatible with them.

Co-Authored-By: Ann Kamyshnikova <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>
Closes-Bug: #1528201
Change-Id: If7bcae39098f40f5ee9db78d3190bf9fdaf6438b
(cherry picked from commit 18e2117e3df3c119f843aed669d0c6bae9243053)
"}]
commit_message:
Call _allocate_vr_id outside of transaction

_allocate_vr_id is called from _set_vr_id, which was starting a
transaction before calling it. This caused an error when the retry
logic was triggered inside of _allocate_vr_id since it would
encounter a DB exception and put the transaction into a bad state
that couldn't be used on the retry.

This patch just stops _set_vr_id from starting a transaction because
it didn't serve a purpose. It also stops _allocate_vr_id from allowing
subtransactions when it starts a transaction, since it's retry logic
isn't compatible with them.

Co-Authored-By: Ann Kamyshnikova <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>
Closes-Bug: #1528201
Change-Id: If7bcae39098f40f5ee9db78d3190bf9fdaf6438b
(cherry picked from commit 18e2117e3df3c119f843aed669d0c6bae9243053)

This patch moves the start notifications emitted in the API
layer ('network.create.start', etc) to before the DB retry

commit_message:
Move notifications before DB retry decorator

This patch moves the start notifications emitted in the API
layer ('network.create.start', etc) to before the DB retry
decorator. This prevents benign retry events from resending
notifications onto the message bus.

Change-Id: I8159692a107ede397a4abeff71310a99fffa4862
Closes-Bug: #1532051
(cherry picked from commit 447f4b14614988f38a26d5d1b8e439ad0a44d8ad)

commit_message:
[zmq] Added redis sentinel HA implementation to zmq driver

List of redis sentinel hosts is now supported in order to
use automatic failover when redis master goes down.

Closes-Bug: #1518292

commit_message:
[zmq] Add TTL to redis records

New option 'zmq_target_expire' added which defines the
TTL in seconds for each target key.

Consumers should periodically update their target records in
background.

Change-Id: Ic4f2fc46b55e324dd9b6ecb7436a00141a4cd881
Closes-Bug: #1524097

commit_message:
Adding a lowercase converter in utils.py

Certain NeutronClient CLIs require input in lower cases.
In order to allow user to provide input in a case-insensitive format,
similar to the uppercase function already existing in utils.py,
this patch adds a lowercase function.

Reference:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140628/16..18/neutronclient/common/utils.py

Change-Id: I3ad44a24a3a341209d3d3a033691b09d98b72e55

commit_message:
Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method in favor of warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning, so we
prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Idb94cb400d693649b66d03329268acc10695e0ca

commit_message:
Use auth_uri to get nova credentials

This change updates the puppet-nova module to use the new keys
for authentication, since auth_host, auth_port and auth_protocol
were deprecated in favor of auth_uri.

Change-Id: Id0183eaf8a93d45b6374777ddcf80c0f3f2dbebb
Closes-Bug: #1521539
(cherry picked from commit b7c535598246e12dc678e608f38302be9abbfd88)

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

The usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed
to a meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

Change-Id: I38e6e2708e353c8a9a343fd34c5b4625eb12f9fb
Closes-Bug: #1512207

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 7515, 'name': 'Jian LI', 'email': 'ljianbj@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'leejian0612'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9828, 'name': 'Radware CI', 'email': 'openstack3rdpartytesting@radware.com', 'username': 'radware3rdpartytesting', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}, {'_account_id': 12040, 'name': 'A10 Networks CI', 'email': 'a10-openstack-ci@a10networks.com', 'username': 'a10networks-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12403, 'name': 'Al Miller', 'email': 'al.miller@ajmiller.net', 'username': 'ajmiller'}, {'_account_id': 13667, 'name': 'ZongKai LI', 'email': 'onionpiece@163.com', 'username': 'lzklibj'}, {'_account_id': 17523, 'name': 'yaowei', 'email': 'yaowei@unitedstack.com', 'username': 'yaowei'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-09-09 02:16:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/test_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron_lbaas/extensions/lbaas_agentschedulerv2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/drivers/common/agent_driver_base.py'], 'message': 'Support schedule loadbalancer manually

when multi neutron-lbassv2-agent exist, each loadbalnacer is scheduled
randomly on creation, and once a loadbalancer is binded to a agent, it's
fixed, and cann't be changed according user's needs, this is not
flexible.
The patch here implement functions liking "l3-agent-router-add"
"l3-agent-router-remove", and can be used to remove loadbalancer from
its default lbaasv2 agent, or add one loadbalancer(without hosting
agent) to a specified agent. it is helpful in production environment,
since it can balance the network traffic, and may also be useful in
lbaas ha implemention.

Get the agent hosting loadbalancer:
GET /v2.0/loadbalancers/<LOADBALANCER_ID>/loadbalancer-agent.json

Delete the loadbalancer from one agent:
DELETE /v2.0/loadbalancers/<LOADBALANCER_ID>/loadbalancer-agent/<AGENT_ID>.json

Add the loadbalancer to the agent:
POST /v2.0/loadbalancers/<LOADBALANCER_ID>/loadbalancer-agent.json
{'agent_id': <AGENT_ID>}

Depends-on: Ib47e6be25b487da0de399dfb2b3c988fc2dde695
Closes-bug: #1474277
Change-Id: Id41d3548cf1ac7ce3f861da2631156a40bf857e5
'}]
commit_message:
Support schedule loadbalancer manually

when multi neutron-lbassv2-agent exist, each loadbalnacer is scheduled
randomly on creation, and once a loadbalancer is binded to a agent, it's
fixed, and cann't be changed according user's needs, this is not
flexible.
The patch here implement functions liking "l3-agent-router-add"
"l3-agent-router-remove", and can be used to remove loadbalancer from
its default lbaasv2 agent, or add one loadbalancer(without hosting
agent) to a specified agent. it is helpful in production environment,
since it can balance the network traffic, and may also be useful in
lbaas ha implemention.

Get the agent hosting loadbalancer:
GET /v2.0/loadbalancers/<LOADBALANCER_ID>/loadbalancer-agent.json

Delete the loadbalancer from one agent:
DELETE /v2.0/loadbalancers/<LOADBALANCER_ID>/loadbalancer-agent/<AGENT_ID>.json

Add the loadbalancer to the agent:
POST /v2.0/loadbalancers/<LOADBALANCER_ID>/loadbalancer-agent.json
{'agent_id': <AGENT_ID>}

Depends-on: Ib47e6be25b487da0de399dfb2b3c988fc2dde695
Closes-bug: #1474277
Change-Id: Id41d3548cf1ac7ce3f861da2631156a40bf857e5

subject: Improve `helper_command' config default
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-12 04:35:54.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_privsep/daemon.py', 'oslo_privsep/tests/test_daemon.py', 'oslo_privsep/priv_context.py'], 'message': 'Improve `helper_command' config default

This option needs to capture the current oslo_config in some way, so it
can be reconstructed in the new privileged process (when using the
'sudo/rootwrap' method).  The previous version had a "$project"
placeholder default that didn't work in real usage (as expected).  This
new version generates a default value at run-time based on the values of
cfg.CONF.{config_file,config_dir}.

If the deployer has provided an explicit value for `helper_command' then
the new cfg.CONF logic is also ignored.

Note secure deployments will capture this command line in sudoers or
rootwrap filters, and it is up to sudo/rootwrap to verify that whatever
we generate here is secure and reasonable.

Note also that this and the surrounding code is ignored when using the
'fork' method.

Change-Id: I0d31bf24cac6c26f10b5d1eebaa8f475402f73d2
'}]
commit_message:
Improve `helper_command' config default

This option needs to capture the current oslo_config in some way, so it
can be reconstructed in the new privileged process (when using the
'sudo/rootwrap' method).  The previous version had a "$project"
placeholder default that didn't work in real usage (as expected).  This
new version generates a default value at run-time based on the values of
cfg.CONF.{config_file,config_dir}.

If the deployer has provided an explicit value for `helper_command' then
the new cfg.CONF logic is also ignored.

Note secure deployments will capture this command line in sudoers or
rootwrap filters, and it is up to sudo/rootwrap to verify that whatever
we generate here is secure and reasonable.

Note also that this and the surrounding code is ignored when using the
'fork' method.

Change-Id: I0d31bf24cac6c26f10b5d1eebaa8f475402f73d2

commit_message:
oslo.messaging option group/name change for notification topics

In Ib51e2839f9035d0cc0e3f459939d9f9003a8c810, oslo.messaging
is introducing a new group for the notifiction options. This
review is the minimum needed to support both old and
newer oslo.messaging versions. (In other words, next
oslo.messaging release will break ceilometer unless we
work around for the new option group)

Depends-On: Ieffb4184cd7bc47e7d71434175f75a5be07bd112
Change-Id: I4765b3b9627983a245aa5521a85ad89e83ab8551
(cherry picked from commit 155d4fa894ea07264c03db73ba0828d3b96de1ae)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-28 10:23:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "Match router status to admin_state

In the reference L3 the router status is always set to ACTIVE.
However, when the admin_state_up is set to False, the router is
disabled on the agent.

This patch just matches the status to the admin_state_up value in
the mixin for the reference implementation.

Ultimately, we will want to start the routers in the DOWN status
and have the agent inform the server that it can be transitioned
to ACTIVE after wiring or DOWN when it's offline. However, that will
likely require a spec on how to decide when a distributed router
is ACTIVE vs DOWN.

Closes-Bug: #1498656
Change-Id: I8f34d12ea1b8b57d502497e5de05324fb87a5ce8
"}]
commit_message:
Match router status to admin_state

In the reference L3 the router status is always set to ACTIVE.
However, when the admin_state_up is set to False, the router is
disabled on the agent.

This patch just matches the status to the admin_state_up value in
the mixin for the reference implementation.

Ultimately, we will want to start the routers in the DOWN status
and have the agent inform the server that it can be transitioned
to ACTIVE after wiring or DOWN when it's offline. However, that will
likely require a spec on how to decide when a distributed router
is ACTIVE vs DOWN.

Closes-Bug: #1498656
Change-Id: I8f34d12ea1b8b57d502497e5de05324fb87a5ce8

commit_message:
Fix doc incorrectly specifying alert-error

The settings doc specifies 'alert-error', when horizon uses
'alert-danger'. This causes unexpected behaviour when altering
HORIZON_CONFIG, such as alerts that don't fade (see bug report)

Change-Id: I8e5f3e253db980700f6064264e985ea8cde759d4
Closes-Bug: 1312499

commit_message:
Bump neutronclient in upper-constraints to 4.0.0

neutronclient 4.0.0 supports various features added in Mitaka Neutron
and is a first release for Mitaka.

There is no need to bump global-requirements.
All features except XML support and Cisco/Nuage vendor features
are backward-compatible.

Depends-On: If4feccb1ac113619e1e895769129bb933b9bf814
Change-Id: I4baa44bfeecd067472db05bc15f17acf4de6554b

revisions:
[{'number': 38, 'created': '2016-01-12 15:06:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/numa_topology_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/fakes.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_numa_topology_filters.py'], 'message': "Add 'hw:cpu_thread_policy=require' scheduling

The 'require' CPU threads policy ensure that hosts are required to have
an SMT architecture and that it be possible to schedule an instance
utilising the thread siblings.

The 'require' policy should and will only be used when explicitly
requested by the instance or image. The existing 'prefer' policy
(though it wasn't called this before) is retained and will be used both
when requested and as the default, per the spec. A stub is included for
the remaining 'isolate' case.

It is necessary to add a filter to exclude hosts with no sibling
support. This ensures that hosts that could not implement this
threading policy are quickly discarded.

Finally, some tests that tested the 'require'-like aspects of the
'prefer' policy are reworked to request this policy explicitly.

Change-Id: Idedf16a734d9d85db08269d05f8c147959a17679
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'hw:cpu_thread_policy=require' scheduling

The 'require' CPU threads policy ensure that hosts are required to have
an SMT architecture and that it be possible to schedule an instance
utilising the thread siblings.

The 'require' policy should and will only be used when explicitly
requested by the instance or image. The existing 'prefer' policy
(though it wasn't called this before) is retained and will be used both
when requested and as the default, per the spec. A stub is included for
the remaining 'isolate' case.

It is necessary to add a filter to exclude hosts with no sibling
support. This ensures that hosts that could not implement this
threading policy are quickly discarded.

Finally, some tests that tested the 'require'-like aspects of the
'prefer' policy are reworked to request this policy explicitly.

Change-Id: Idedf16a734d9d85db08269d05f8c147959a17679
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning

commit_message:
swift-init: New option kill-after-timeout

This option send SIGKILL to daemon after kill_wait period.
When daemon hangs and doesn't respond to SIGTERM/SIGHUP
there is no way to stop it using swift-init now. Classic
init scripts in Linux kills hanged process after grace
period and this patch add same behaviour. This is most
usefull when using "restart" on hanged daemon.

Change-Id: I8c932b673a0f51e52132df87ea2f4396f4bba9d8

Transfer table does a one time allocation
for allocatedIds and does not watch changes to
allocated. As a result, when the allocated
list is fetched at a later point, the allocatedIds
are not updated resulting in a broken view.

commit_message:
Transfer table should update allocatedIds on allocated change

Transfer table does a one time allocation
for allocatedIds and does not watch changes to
allocated. As a result, when the allocated
list is fetched at a later point, the allocatedIds
are not updated resulting in a broken view.

Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-flavors
Closes-Bug: #1531334

Change-Id: I807c682b69081f90fc3d74675e8ca149bb855521

commit_message:
Create V9 version of resource driver interface

In preparation for projects acting as domains (which will result
in driver interface changes), a V9 version of the resource
interface is created, along with the wrapper support scaffolding
for V8 drivers.

Partially Implements: blueprint reseller

Change-Id: Iec6f7fe2347b64c8f721e968b816e6c1b4332d0a

subject: Create a ISO Date Time Filter
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-11 18:19:34.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/util/filters/filters.spec.js', 'horizon/static/framework/util/filters/filters.js'], 'message': 'Create a ISO Date Time Filter

The filter converts the string date into ISO-8610 format,
which adds proper UTC timezone identifier which can then
be used by Angular.

Dates returned by various API may be in date formats other
than ISO. This filter converts them to ISO Dates which can
then be processed by standard Angular filters as documentated on
https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/filter/date

Partially implements: bp ng-hypervisors

Change-Id: I97210b3c25927285cbbadb1d07ede241226bd46d
'}]
commit_message:
Create a ISO Date Time Filter

The filter converts the string date into ISO-8610 format,
which adds proper UTC timezone identifier which can then
be used by Angular.

Dates returned by various API may be in date formats other
than ISO. This filter converts them to ISO Dates which can
then be processed by standard Angular filters as documentated on
https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/filter/date

Partially implements: bp ng-hypervisors

Change-Id: I97210b3c25927285cbbadb1d07ede241226bd46d

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This problem has been solved on Tempest already.
This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Idc78db1c788b3d611bec980b44b21d56afc864ac
Closes-Bug: #1465086

subject: VMware LBaaSv1 method uses invalid context
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-02 08:48:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/drivers/vmware/edge_driver.py'], 'message': "VMware LBaaSv1 method uses invalid context

VMware LBaaSv1 driver supplies the Neutron plugin with a method, which allows
detection of Edge appliance use by the LBaaS driver.
The is_edge_in_use() method is using a context which is invalid: the driver
has no self.context property and shouldn't have one.
Instead, the context should pass as parameter.

Change-Id: I7f3b95b43f87b35d641f0c7535d648ee178eda41
Closes-Bug: #1521160
"}]
commit_message:
VMware LBaaSv1 method uses invalid context

VMware LBaaSv1 driver supplies the Neutron plugin with a method, which allows
detection of Edge appliance use by the LBaaS driver.
The is_edge_in_use() method is using a context which is invalid: the driver
has no self.context property and shouldn't have one.
Instead, the context should pass as parameter.

Change-Id: I7f3b95b43f87b35d641f0c7535d648ee178eda41
Closes-Bug: #1521160

commit_message:
Replaces __builtin__ with six.moves.builtins

__builtin__ does not exist in Python 3. Replacing it with
six.moves.builtins will ensure compatibility with both Python 2.7
and Python 3.4.

Change-Id: Id185ee8331e69b534d43f6898e2c2163dbd99425

Current code will refresh dnsmasq configure files and
restart dnsmasq process when dhcp-agent restart, even
nothing changed to neutron network.

changing to dnsmasq configures, if nothing changed

Closes-bug: #1496844
Change-Id: I18ac5bf3388116595d157b64ad265f56c2c1ff73

commit_message:
not always restart dnsmasq when dhcp-agnet restart

Current code will refresh dnsmasq configure files and
restart dnsmasq process when dhcp-agent restart, even
nothing changed to neutron network.

It seems unnecessary to restart dnsmasq there is no
changing to dnsmasq configures, if nothing changed
happened to neutron network.

Closes-bug: #1496844
Change-Id: I18ac5bf3388116595d157b64ad265f56c2c1ff73

commit_message:
Leverage new neutronresources table to simplify RBAC

This patch migrates the networkrbacs table to a generic
resourcerbacs table which greatly simplifies the lookup
of RBAC entries for networks and any future objects.

Change-Id: I702232cfc9848288b80443bf7df0288fda062e5a

commit_message:
loadimpact perf improvement with batched ovs-vsctl statements

Few modifications to group some ovs-vsctl ops as transactions.
Some of the vsctl calls cannot be clubbed due to their
inter-dependencies for data/logic as it is structured in the
current agent code. Also there is open flow add/mod calls
to ofctl which also could be optimized if they can be clubbed.
Couldn't find a way to provide multiple commands to ofctl.

Pending...
- ofctl flow adds/mods are still not batched/bundled
- getportofport() calls are still not batched

This patch is to get some early feedback to judge if it is
headed in the right direction, and whether it will bring in
some perf improvements in 100+ (many) node environments.
Please help in testing the patch in your many node env.
If the results are positive, I'll continue working on
this to further optimize.

Need comments/suggestions on how to bundle ofctl
adds/mods and further improve upon the changes
submitted here.

Change-Id: Ie20f124beb6ecb92efad3622a33c008025e659ab
Partial-Bug: 1264608

commit_message:
CONF.reset does not happen for all tests

DietTestCase does not currently reset the global CONF
object. Any test that inherits from DietTestCase
directly could have potential left over configuration
values from previous tests in the same worker process.
This could lead to errors very difficult to diagnose.

(failing in the gate)

Change-Id: Ied61cd714639986add137577fffca07cd5a09c1b

commit_message:
provision_local_vlan no flooding flows with l2pop

Fixes the bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1312257

When l2-population option is activated the provision_local_vlan will not setup a flow to flood packets.

Change-Id: I0673a8c73ffb3a55d5f47112aab483fef50baaf7

commit_message:
Redirecting some modules to a neutron-lib DO NOT MERGE

The purpose of this commit is to identify what "could" be moved to a
library, and what it takes to do that (realizing the chain of depend-
encies, in some cases).

For the actual migration, we need to think about "whether" items should
be moved, and where the division should be, for modules that are not
moved en-masse. There may be cases where we need to refactor the code,
to tease apart the needed library functionality.

Some tricky areas (deciding the dividing point or separating dependencies)
may be:

- database
- migration
- plugin
- API extensions
- policy
- context

Areas so far, that seemed easy are:

- constants
- exceptions
- callbacks

TODO: Check if any using i18n and put them back.

Note: Need to tag items with debtcollector.

Change-Id: I8e30117035b76b622caa74872fa1908cd2cf7c8f

commit_message:
Add stt type driver to ML2

This patch adds a type driver to leverage the STT protocol that was recently
added to OpenvSwitch. For more details about STT checkout:
https://tools.ietf.org/pdf/draft-davie-stt-06.pdf

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1461068
Change-Id: Ife8fbd7933ffafb44dd930b513f36fe560d395d6

commit_message:
Mechanism driver status sync

Add mdsyncstatus DB to record the failure caused by
update_xxx_post_commit mechanism driver(s).
Add a period function to loop the record in this DB, try to re-call
the previous failed method, and update the DB based on the result.
Add a RESTful API to show the DB content.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: I08f8f4d6bc259b39d4100b0df17a1933e6e021b9

commit_message:
Set kernel gc_thresh values to higher config value

The gc_thresh values that control the maximum size of the kernel's
ARP table and IPv6 neighbor table are low for a node serving hundreds
of tenants.

This patch makes the L3 agent set this to a configurable minimum at
startup with a default set to a more realistic value for an L3 node.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1490060
Change-Id: I6aac66fb8e96d337f34a08276cdc98885cdc56f6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Benton <blak111@gmail.com>

subject: Fix the regression of neutronclient/shell.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 05:11:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Fix the regression of neutronclient/shell.py

Now,in python-neutronclient,
We can't get authentication with os-token and os-url.
but on Icehouse,We can do this.
The problem is below:
in icehouse version, if os_token has been given,
auth_session is no longer need to get again.
in now version, this judge is missed, so it do again.
and the error happens, because  parameter value(auth_url)
is not provided.(Ofcourse,it should not be provided )

I add this judge to fix the  regression
Closes-Bug: #1450414

Change-Id: I5f1bdc605977397e80a79b04d709881c8a8a4389
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the regression of neutronclient/shell.py

Now,in python-neutronclient,
We can't get authentication with os-token and os-url.
but on Icehouse,We can do this.
The problem is below:
in icehouse version, if os_token has been given,
auth_session is no longer need to get again.
in now version, this judge is missed, so it do again.
and the error happens, because  parameter value(auth_url)
is not provided.(Ofcourse,it should not be provided )

I add this judge to fix the  regression
Closes-Bug: #1450414

Change-Id: I5f1bdc605977397e80a79b04d709881c8a8a4389

commit_message:
lb: Moving Common Agent and tests to separate file

Moving the common agent from the linuxbridge context into
to a separate file. Also copy unittests and make them
generic.

Change-Id: Ib36f97dd37b973f86627b391e0853f66eb9816f2
Partial-Bug: #1468803
Partial-Bug: #1480979

commit_message:
Common l2_extension test code moved to the right directory

neutron/tests/common/agents belong to dummy agents used during functional
testing. This patch creates neutron/tests/common/agent to hold
common agent test code available to the different types of testing,
in this case this code is used by functional, and will be reused in
fullstack testing.
neutron/tests/common/agents is renamed to test_agents to make clear
those are small agents tuned for test.

Change-Id: I89fdfe861303fd69cd7e90af92b6a4f746716cea

commit_message:
Downgrade 'device not on plugin' to debug

These messages frequently occur when a port was updated
right before it was deleted. It's a normal condition during
a busy system so it's not worth bothering operators about
it.

Change-Id: I5d3b1123e5f3e0da369b582368b691ebf0d4eebe

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-06-08 17:23:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_port.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/port.py'], 'message': 'Invalid fixed-ip value should return meaningful message

Current if the fixed-ip value is invalid, neutron client
returns ValueError exception from the dict to user.
In order to provide more meaningful error, Neutron client
should catch the ValueError and return a meaningful
error instead.

Steps to reproduce:
1. neutron port-create --fixed-ip 10.0.0.4 private

It will return dictionary update sequence element #0 has
length 1; 2 is required

Change-Id: I2aac38ab2908cdcf56a32289bd0a80e9ca25d077
Closes-bug: 1423747
'}]
commit_message:
Invalid fixed-ip value should return meaningful message

Current if the fixed-ip value is invalid, neutron client
returns ValueError exception from the dict to user.
In order to provide more meaningful error, Neutron client
should catch the ValueError and return a meaningful
error instead.

Steps to reproduce:
1. neutron port-create --fixed-ip 10.0.0.4 private

It will return dictionary update sequence element #0 has
length 1; 2 is required

Change-Id: I2aac38ab2908cdcf56a32289bd0a80e9ca25d077
Closes-bug: 1423747

- add a new field in agent_state.configuration: fp_offload to report
  to the mechanism driver.

- modify LinuxBridge mech driver:
  - to set vif_type to vhost-user when fp_offload is True, else set vif_type
    to VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE like before.
  - to add new fields (vhost_user_socket, vhost_user_fp_plug) to vif_details
    when fp_offload is True.

- update the unit test for LinuxBridge to generate VIF_TYPE and VIF_DETAILS
  in function of FP_OFFLOAD. By default, FP_OFFLOAD is set to False.
  A new unit tests is added for testing when FP_OFFLOAD is True.

Closes-Bug: #1517146
Change-Id: If949471dc906838e21d308d0930485901a6cba00
Signed-off-by: Maxime Leroy <maxime.leroy@6wind.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add vhost-user support for linux bridge via fp_offload detection

- add a new field in agent_state.configuration: fp_offload to report
  to the mechanism driver.

- modify LinuxBridge mech driver:
  - to set vif_type to vhost-user when fp_offload is True, else set vif_type
    to VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE like before.
  - to add new fields (vhost_user_socket, vhost_user_fp_plug) to vif_details
    when fp_offload is True.

- update the unit test for LinuxBridge to generate VIF_TYPE and VIF_DETAILS
  in function of FP_OFFLOAD. By default, FP_OFFLOAD is set to False.
  A new unit tests is added for testing when FP_OFFLOAD is True.

Closes-Bug: #1517146
Change-Id: If949471dc906838e21d308d0930485901a6cba00
Signed-off-by: Maxime Leroy <maxime.leroy@6wind.com>

commit_message:
neutron lbaas should add timestamp field

Now the related bp(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/210955/) would
add a timestamp field to neutron core resources. And make the patch
'I24114b464403435d9c1e1e123d2bc2f37c8fc6ea' depends on this patch.

As neutron lbaas uses the modified resource file like models_v2.py,
so lbaas should add the same fields to the neutron resource which
it use. This patch will fit the requirement of bp.

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-port-timestamp
Change-Id: I2a01e57d38a69e8534d748518355e79c187a2544
Closes-Bug: #1492683

commit_message:
Add timestamp for neutron extension resources

Currently, neutron extension resources (like router, floatingip,
securitygroup and securitygrouprule) don't savexs time-stamps upon
their creation and updation. This information is critical for
debugging and perfomance purposes.

This patch base on patch: I24114b464403435d9c1e1e123d2bc2f37c8fc6ea
to add timestamp fields to neutron extension resources.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I4789771779dcb14beb08b766c8c43019853c4015

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-21 01:17:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/service.py'], 'message': "Display function name exceeding scheduled interval

The following bug fix replaces the 'task' message displayed in the
FixedIntervalLoopingCall error message whenever the sublass
exceeds its scheduled interval. The 'task' message was changed from
displaying the python object to displaying the function exceeding its
schedule.

Previous message exaple:
WARNING neutron.openstack.common.loopingcall [req-4f447ecc-0ea4-4651-
883b-1f7dab14beba ] task <bound method Service.periodic_tasks of
<neutron.service.Service object at 0x3206290>> run outlasted interval
by 20.02 sec

New message example:
WARNING neutron.openstack.common.loopingcall [req-4f447ecc-0ea4-4651-
883b-1f7dab14beba ] task <'L3NATAgentWithStateReport.periodic_sync_
routers_task'> run outlasted interval by 20.02 sec

Partial-bug: #1509008

Change-Id: I3dce1c9cb945f18f268bdd2fcedd34cbfc5664d6
"}]
commit_message:
Display function name exceeding scheduled interval

The following bug fix replaces the 'task' message displayed in the
FixedIntervalLoopingCall error message whenever the sublass
exceeds its scheduled interval. The 'task' message was changed from
displaying the python object to displaying the function exceeding its
schedule.

Previous message exaple:
WARNING neutron.openstack.common.loopingcall [req-4f447ecc-0ea4-4651-
883b-1f7dab14beba ] task <bound method Service.periodic_tasks of
<neutron.service.Service object at 0x3206290>> run outlasted interval
by 20.02 sec

New message example:
WARNING neutron.openstack.common.loopingcall [req-4f447ecc-0ea4-4651-
883b-1f7dab14beba ] task <'L3NATAgentWithStateReport.periodic_sync_
routers_task'> run outlasted interval by 20.02 sec

Partial-bug: #1509008

Change-Id: I3dce1c9cb945f18f268bdd2fcedd34cbfc5664d6

commit_message:
WIP Remove deprecated external_network_bridge option

L3 agent external_network_bridge option has been deprecated in Liberty.
This change removes it.

TODO:
* Handle L3 RPC old versions
* Update L3 RPC version
* Remove useless get_external_network_id functions/methods
* Update unit/functional/fullstack tests
* Document/Automate(?) migration

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1508188
Related-Bug: #1491668
Change-Id: I5489401de482bd8e870f64759e2d943fbb54f9d3

Curent neutorn could not guarantee the enforcement of extensions like SG
and QOS, that will bring some problems when port_binding, like
hierarchical port binding.
This BP will introduce a new flag in MD and parameter indicated

Change-Id: I63b12e627b1fcd362a3a4262b25e065c570a0f7c
'}]
commit_message:
Guarantee securitygroup enforcement in ML2 mechanism drivers

Curent neutorn could not guarantee the enforcement of extensions like SG
and QOS, that will bring some problems when port_binding, like
hierarchical port binding.
This BP will introduce a new flag in MD and parameter indicated
whether enforcement is mandatory and enforcement status used in
port_binding to fix it.

Change-Id: I63b12e627b1fcd362a3a4262b25e065c570a0f7c

commit_message:
Clean up horizon.scss - _layout.scss

A major part of the css reorg is a better organization of the css
styles themselves. horizon.scss should be a global import level file.

Move remaining layout styles to _layout.scss.  Also, fix minor
bug with min size.

Change-Id: I6dd847e65a2cbf7f8dc9e415bed4a6958e3b787e
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V unit tests for latest os_win release

os_win release 0.1.0 causes unit tests to fail, as the wmi
module does not exist. Mocking it will fix the issue.

Change-Id: Iad91cd280e04db0000b58e1194350489b2044506
Closes-Bug: #1533290

subject: Using session pool for p11 opertions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-09 16:28:45.000000000', 'files': ['etc/barbican/barbican.conf', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/p11_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/crypto/test_p11_crypto.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/pkcs11.py'], 'message': 'Using session pool for p11 opertions

Instead of open/close a p11 session for each pkcs11 calls, we can
create a pool of shared sessions when HSM crypto plugin is
initialized, all pkcs11 API calls then can grab one existing
available seesion from pool, execute the operation and return the
seesion back to the pool when the job is done.

With this change, we can see about 40% barbican key operation
performance improvement when HSM is used.

Change-Id: I8f625430a7a6aa6ce159b800542cb77c7b392963
'}]
commit_message:
Using session pool for p11 opertions

Instead of open/close a p11 session for each pkcs11 calls, we can
create a pool of shared sessions when HSM crypto plugin is
initialized, all pkcs11 API calls then can grab one existing
available seesion from pool, execute the operation and return the
seesion back to the pool when the job is done.

With this change, we can see about 40% barbican key operation
performance improvement when HSM is used.

Change-Id: I8f625430a7a6aa6ce159b800542cb77c7b392963

commit_message:
Add the condition for using a project term

Most projects contain both their own project name and service name,
and **project name** vs. **service type** guideline is defined for
most cases. However, on current big-tent trend, some projects don't
contain them. So this patch makes the guideline clear for most cases.

Change-Id: I75cabcf0787073d96b6536c4e70b63ed73b814e3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 13:11:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': "Call _allocate_vr_id outside of transaction

_allocate_vr_id is called from _set_vr_id, which was starting a
transaction before calling it. This caused an error when the retry
logic was triggered inside of _allocate_vr_id since it would
encounter a DB exception and put the transaction into a bad state
that couldn't be used on the retry.

This patch just stops _set_vr_id from starting a transaction because
it didn't serve a purpose. It also stops _allocate_vr_id from allowing
subtransactions when it starts a transaction, since it's retry logic
isn't compatible with them.

Co-Authored-By: Ann Kamyshnikova <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>
Closes-Bug: #1528201
Change-Id: If7bcae39098f40f5ee9db78d3190bf9fdaf6438b
(cherry picked from commit 18e2117e3df3c119f843aed669d0c6bae9243053)
"}]
commit_message:
Call _allocate_vr_id outside of transaction

_allocate_vr_id is called from _set_vr_id, which was starting a
transaction before calling it. This caused an error when the retry
logic was triggered inside of _allocate_vr_id since it would
encounter a DB exception and put the transaction into a bad state
that couldn't be used on the retry.

This patch just stops _set_vr_id from starting a transaction because
it didn't serve a purpose. It also stops _allocate_vr_id from allowing
subtransactions when it starts a transaction, since it's retry logic
isn't compatible with them.

Co-Authored-By: Ann Kamyshnikova <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>
Closes-Bug: #1528201
Change-Id: If7bcae39098f40f5ee9db78d3190bf9fdaf6438b
(cherry picked from commit 18e2117e3df3c119f843aed669d0c6bae9243053)

subject: Remove index API
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-04 17:41:39.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/unit/v1/test_search.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_api.py', 'searchlight/api/v1/router.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-remove-index-api-df875bd8637bb675.yaml', 'searchlight/api/v1/search.py'], 'message': "Remove index API

The index API is a passthrough to elasticsearch. Given the changes
we're making with aliasing, and that we perform significant transforms
on raw data from the APIs, there a few legitimate reasons to do this.

A future suggested replacement is an API to request indexing of a
specific instance of a resource type that would go through the proper
serialization functions.

Change-Id: I070909176aace9c30638de7e31cd7545c8d84918
Implements: blueprint remove-index-api
"}]
commit_message:
Remove index API

The index API is a passthrough to elasticsearch. Given the changes
we're making with aliasing, and that we perform significant transforms
on raw data from the APIs, there a few legitimate reasons to do this.

A future suggested replacement is an API to request indexing of a
specific instance of a resource type that would go through the proper
serialization functions.

Change-Id: I070909176aace9c30638de7e31cd7545c8d84918
Implements: blueprint remove-index-api

subject: Fix functional test [api] config section
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-12 21:52:17.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/functional/__init__.py'], 'message': "Fix functional test [api] config section

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/253981/ moved the API config
options to their own section; this wasn't reflected in the functional
tests, which was only a problem because the shutdown code can't deal
with multiple worker processes.

Moved bind_host, bind_port and workers to an [api] section, and
hardcoded workers=0 (since the test runner is already spawning multiple
test processes, and multiple API processes within that seems
egregious).

Change-Id: I84aa45620f426025148365057cc9edf6bca6db6f
Closes-Bug: #1532306
"}]
commit_message:
Fix functional test [api] config section

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/253981/ moved the API config
options to their own section; this wasn't reflected in the functional
tests, which was only a problem because the shutdown code can't deal
with multiple worker processes.

Moved bind_host, bind_port and workers to an [api] section, and
hardcoded workers=0 (since the test runner is already spawning multiple
test processes, and multiple API processes within that seems
egregious).

Change-Id: I84aa45620f426025148365057cc9edf6bca6db6f
Closes-Bug: #1532306

[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-01-10 00:40:35.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/magic-search/hz-magic-search-bar.html', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/material/static/horizon/_styles.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/material/static/horizon/components/_magic_search.scss', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/magic-search/magic-search.html', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/horizon.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/bootstrap/_variables.scss', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/magic-search/magic-search.scss'], 'message': 'Magic Search now inherits from Bootstrap Theme

The magic search css was not themeable out of the box.  Also, we were
overriding almost every style in it with our own.  This causes
unneccessary complexity in the css; we should just not include it and
provide css that uses theme variables.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

Change-Id: I116e32b64bd6ba4c8f3e65fd1e145387f3071663
'}]
commit_message:
Magic Search now inherits from Bootstrap Theme

The magic search css was not themeable out of the box.  Also, we were
overriding almost every style in it with our own.  This causes
unneccessary complexity in the css; we should just not include it and
provide css that uses theme variables.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

Change-Id: I116e32b64bd6ba4c8f3e65fd1e145387f3071663

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-10 12:16:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/router.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_router.py'], 'message': 'Enhance the help info of "neutron router-gateway-set"

complete.

Below is the help message of "neutron router-gateway-set":

usage: neutron router-gateway-set [-h] [--request-format {json,xml}]
       [--disable-snat] [--fixed-ip FIXED_IP]
       ROUTER EXTERNAL-NETWORK
neutron router-gateway-set: error: too few arguments

Modified the help message and added unit test.

       [--disable-snat] [--fixed-ip subnet_id=SUBNET,ip_address=IP_ADDR]
       ROUTER EXTERNAL-NETWORK

Closes-Bug: 1527129
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance the help info of "neutron router-gateway-set"

The help info of "neutron router-gateway-set" is not much
complete.

Below is the help message of "neutron router-gateway-set":

usage: neutron router-gateway-set [-h] [--request-format {json,xml}]
       [--disable-snat] [--fixed-ip FIXED_IP]
       ROUTER EXTERNAL-NETWORK
neutron router-gateway-set: error: too few arguments

Modified the help message and added unit test.
Usage should be as below,

usage: neutron router-gateway-set [-h] [--request-format {json,xml}]
       [--disable-snat] [--fixed-ip subnet_id=SUBNET,ip_address=IP_ADDR]
       ROUTER EXTERNAL-NETWORK
neutron router-gateway-set: error: too few arguments

Change-Id: I2a0bbd147803108e4001ffe86594e1201b9c388b
Closes-Bug: 1527129

commit_message:
Add RPCIsSynchronousFixture for synchronous RPC casts

This fixture replaces RPC casts with RPC calls for testing code paths
that communicate over RPC cast in order to verify an expected state
after the path completes.

Change-Id: I198117445eff8ba75af18f1487cdbc6a03b88687

unsafe assertions where two lists are compared and it
fails when order of inner elements is different, but

Closes-Bug: #1531667

commit_message:
A tempest test in services API using unsafe assert

Test "test_get_service_by_invalid_params" performs
unsafe assertions where two lists are compared and it
fails when order of inner elements is different, but
this case should be considered OK.

Change-Id: I15efc590d45afb6e025c0e920177c58e57eebadb
Closes-Bug: #1531667

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-03 23:49:37.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/quotas.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_quotas.py', 'cinder/db/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Fix update quota of subprojects

Cinder raises an exception when performing an update quota
operation in a subproject in which its parent's quotas weren't
explicitly updated.

This is because cinder will try to find the parent's quotas
in order to update the allocated value. But, since the parent's
quotas are the default quotas (i.e. there are no entries for them
in the database), the operation will raise an error.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a project A in keystone;
2. Create a project B in keystone with A as its parent;
3. Try to update the quota value of any resources of project B
   (e.g. openstack quota set <id of B> --volumes 2)

This patch fix this bug by adding entries to the database when
performing an update quota operation in a subproject and there
are still no quota associated with the parent project.

Change-Id: Ia732ca9d5a5f59d3973c2656a27b666077c3402a
Closes-bug: #1495990
"}]
commit_message:
Fix update quota of subprojects

Cinder raises an exception when performing an update quota
operation in a subproject in which its parent's quotas weren't
explicitly updated.

This is because cinder will try to find the parent's quotas
in order to update the allocated value. But, since the parent's
quotas are the default quotas (i.e. there are no entries for them
in the database), the operation will raise an error.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a project A in keystone;
2. Create a project B in keystone with A as its parent;
3. Try to update the quota value of any resources of project B
   (e.g. openstack quota set <id of B> --volumes 2)

This patch fix this bug by adding entries to the database when
performing an update quota operation in a subproject and there
are still no quota associated with the parent project.

Change-Id: Ia732ca9d5a5f59d3973c2656a27b666077c3402a
Closes-bug: #1495990

commit_message:
Make _discover_extensions public

Heat wants to use
`cinderclient.shell.OpenStackCinderShell._discover_extensions`
function (https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1527071),
which is private currently. It's better to change this method
to public for public use.
This change will do it as novaclient did.

Change-Id: Iaaa4cab530fd495877e15a372fff1354ddbeaa17
Closes-Bug: #1527169
